null.verse 19:59: Po nich však následovali nástupci, kteří modlitbu opustili a jen vášně své sledovali, a ti se setkají s bludem -
null.verse 19:60: kromě těch, kdož pokání činili, víru měli a zbožné skutky konali, Ti do ráje budou uvedeni a nebudou nikterak ošizeni,
null.verse 19:61: do zahrad Edenu, jež přislíbil Milosrdný služebníkům Svým v nepoznatelné věřícím. A pak věru slib Jeho se splní!
null.verse 19:62: A neuslyší tam žádné tlachání, nýbrž jen pozdravy "mír s vámi", a obživu tam budou mít zrána i zvečera.
null.verse 19:63: Takový bude ráj, jenž v dědictví dáme těm ze služebníků Svých, kteří bohabojní byli.
null.verse 19:64: A nesestupujeme leč z rozkazu Pána tvého a Jemu náleží, co je před námi a co je za námi, i to, co je mezi tím; a Pán tvůj není věru zapomnětlivým,
null.verse 19:65: On Pánem je nebes a země a toho, co mezi nimi je. Uctívej Jej tedy a buď vytrvalý v uctívání Jeho. A znáš někoho se jménem stejným?
null.verse 19:66: Člověk se ptá: "Až zemřu, budu z hrobu opět vyveden živý?"
null.verse 19:67: Což si nevzpomene člověk, že jsme jej stvořili již jednou, když ještě nebyl ničím?
null.verse 19:68: Při Pánu tvém, My věru shromáždíme je i satany a pak kol pekla na kolenou je předvedeme
null.verse 19:69: a potom z každé skupiny toho, kdo nejvzpurnější byl proti Milosrdnému, vytáhneme
null.verse 19:70: a My pak výborně poznáme ty, kdož hořet v něm si nejvíc zaslouží.
null.verse 19:71: A mezi vámi není nikoho, kdo by k němu nesestoupil, a to u Pána tvého nezvratné je rozhodnutí.
null.verse 19:72: Potom však zachráníme ty, kdož bohabojní byli, a ponecháme v něm nespravedlivé na kolenou klečící.
null.verse 19:73: Když jsou jim sdělována Naše znamení jako důkazy jasné, tehdy ti, kdož nevěří, říkají věřícím. "Která z obou skupin je na tom lépe postavením svým a krásnější společností?"
null.verse 19:74: Kolik pokolení před vámi jsme již zahubili, jež lepší byla bohatstvím svým i vzhledností!
null.verse 19:75: Rci: "Kéž Milosrdný prodlouží těm, kdož v bludu jsou, délku jejich žití, aby spatřili to, co slíbeno jim bylo - buď trest pozemský, či Hodinu. A pak poznají, kdo postavení má horší a kdo vojskem je slabší."
null.verse 19:76: A Bůh rozmnoží vedení těch, kdož správnou cestou jdou, vždyť skutky zbožné, jež trvají, lepší jsou u Pána tvého odměnou i lepší náhradou.
null.verse 19:77: Co soudíš o tom, jenž ve znamení Naše nevěří a hovoří: "Věru že dostane se mi majetku i dětí"?
null.verse 19:78: Pronikl snad on k nepoznatelnému či uzavřel snad s Milosrdným úmluvu?
null.verse 19:79: Však pozor! My zapíšeme vše, co říká, a prodloužíme mu délku trestu jeho
null.verse 19:80: a zdědíme po něm to, o čem mluví, a přijde k nám osamocen, zbaven všeho.
null.verse 19:81: A vzali si kromě Boha božstva různá, aby jim byla posilou.
null.verse 19:82: Však pozor! Ona uctívání jejich popřou a protivníky jejich se stanou.
null.verse 19:83: Což nevidíš, že jsme vyslali satany proti nevěřícím, aby je ponoukali ke špatnostem?
null.verse 19:84: Neusiluj o uspíšení jejich lhůty; vždyť My počítáme jim přesným počtem.
null.verse 19:85: V den, kdy shromáždíme bohabojné u Milosrdného jako poselstvo
null.verse 19:86: a kdy poženeme hříšníky do pekla jako k napajedlu stádo,
null.verse 19:87: tehdy nevěřící nebudou mít žádnou přímluvu kromě těch, kdož s Milosrdným uzavřeli úmluvu.
null.verse 19:88: Říkajíce, že Milosrdný si vzal děti,
null.verse 19:89: vy spáchali jste věc hnusnou,
null.verse 19:90: že div se nebesa kvůli tomu neroztrhla, země se div nerozpoltila a hory se málem na prach rozpadly,
null.verse 19:91: že Milosrdnému děti lživě připsali.
null.verse 19:92: A nehodí se přece, aby si Milosrdný děti bral,
null.verse 19:93: vždyť všichni, kdož na nebesích a na zemi jsou, k Milosrdnému přicházejí jako služebníci.
null.verse 19:94: A On je věru sečetl a přesným počtem spočítal
null.verse 19:95: a všichni k Němu přijdou v den zmrtvýchvstání jako jedinci.
null.verse 19:96: Těm, kdož uvěřili a zbožné skutky konali, těm věru Milosrdný lásku Svou poskytne.
null.verse 19:97: A učinili jsme jej snadným pro jazyk tvůj, abys zvěst radostnou bohabojným mohl oznámit a lid hádavý tím varovat.
null.verse 19:98: Kolik pokolení před nimi jsme již zahubili! Můžeš snad jediného z nich ucítit či šepotu jejich naslouchat?

null.verse 19:2: Dit is een vermelding van de barmhartigheid van uw Heer, betoond aan Zijn dienaar, Zacharia.
null.verse 19:3: Toen hij zijn Heer in het verborgene aanriep,
null.verse 19:4: Sprak hij: "Mijn Heer, het gebeente in mij is zwak geworden en mijn hoofd glanst met grijze haren, niettemin ben ik niet wanhopig, mijn Heer, bij mijn aanroep tot U."
null.verse 19:5: "Maar ik vrees mijn bloedverwanten na mij; mijn vrouw is onvruchtbaar, geef mij een opvolger van U."
null.verse 19:6: "Opdat hij mij en het Huis van Jacob tot erfgenaam moge zijn. En maak hem, mijn Heer, U welgevallig."
null.verse 19:7: (God antwoordde) "O Zacharia, Wij brengen u blijde tijding omtrent een zoon wiens naam Jahja (Johannes) zal zijn. Wij hebben voordien niemand aan hem gelijk gemaakt."
null.verse 19:8: Hij Sprak: "Mijn Heer, hoe kan mij een zoon geworden, terwijl mijn vrouw onvruchtbaar is en ik de uiterste grens des ouderdoms heb bereikt?"
null.verse 19:9: Hij Sprak: "Het zij zo, Uw Heer zegt: ’Het is gemakkelijk voor Mij, Ik heb u voordien geschapen toen je niets waart.’"
null.verse 19:10: Hij Sprak: "Mijn Heer, geef mij een teken." (God) zei: "Uw teken is dat je voor drie opeenvolgende dagen en nachten tot niemand zult spreken."
null.verse 19:11: Aldus kwam hij uit de kamer tot zijn volk en beduidde hen God in de morgen en in de avond te verheerlijken.
null.verse 19:12: "O Jahja (Johannes), houd u krachtig aan het Boek." Wij schonken hem wijsheid, terwijl hij nog een kind was,
null.verse 19:13: En zachtmoedigheid van Ons en reinheid. En hij was vroom,
null.verse 19:14: Vriendelijk en goed voor zijn ouders. En hij was trots noch opstandig.
null.verse 19:15: Vrede was met hem op de dag zijner geboorte, en op zijn sterfdag, en zal eveneens met hem zijn op de dag waarop hij weer tot leven zal worden gewekt.
null.verse 19:16: En vermeld Maria in het Boek. Toen zij zich van haar volk terugtrok in een op het Oosten uitziende plaats,
null.verse 19:17: En zich aan hun blikken onttrok, zonden Wij Onze engel tot haar en hij verscheen aan haar in de gestalte van een volmaakte man.
null.verse 19:18: Zij Sprak: "Ik neem mijn toevlucht tot de Barmhartige tegen u, laat mij met rust, als je (God) vreest."
null.verse 19:19: Hij antwoordde: "Ik ben slechts een boodschapper van uw Heer om u de geboorte van een reine zoon aan te kondigen."
null.verse 19:20: Zij Sprak: "Hoe kan ik een zoon ontvangen terwijl geen man mij heeft aangeraakt en ik evenmin onkuisheden heb bedreven?"
null.verse 19:21: Hij Sprak: "Het is zo naar uw Heer zegt, ’het is gemakkelijk voor Mij,’" opdat Wij hem tot een teken voor de mensen maken, een genade Onzerzijds; het is een besloten zaak."
null.verse 19:22: En zij ontving hem en trok zich met hem terug in een ver afgelegen oord.
null.verse 19:23: En de smarten der bevalling dreven haar naar de voet van een palmboom. Zij Sprak: "O, liever zou ik vóór dit geschiedde gestorven en in de vergetelheid geraakt zijn."
null.verse 19:24: Dan riep (Gods boodschapper) haar van beneden toe, zeggende: "Treur niet. Uw Heer heeft een beekje aan uw voet doen ontstaan;"
null.verse 19:25: "En schud de stam van de palmboom naar u toe, deze zal verse, rijpe dadels op u doen neervallen;"
null.verse 19:26: "Eet en drink en koel uw oog. En indien je iemand ziet, beduid hem dan: ’Ik heb de Barmhartige gelofte gedaan te vasten; derhalve zal ik heden met niemand spreken.’"
null.verse 19:27: Uiteindelijk bracht zij het kind tot haar volk. Dat sprak: "O Maria, je hebt iets vreemds meegebracht."
null.verse 19:28: "O Zuster van Aäron, uw vader was geen verdorven man noch was uw moeder losbandig."
null.verse 19:29: Dan wees zij naar het kind. Zij zeiden: "Hoe kunnen wij tot een wiegekind spreken?"
null.verse 19:30: Hij (Jezus) Sprak: "Ik ben een dienaar van God. Hij heeft mij het Boek gegeven en mij tot een profeet gemaakt;"
null.verse 19:31: "Hij heeft mij gezegend waar ik ook ben; en heeft mij het gebed en het geven van aalmoezen opgelegd zolang ik leef."
null.verse 19:32: "En dat ik gehoorzaam zou zijn jegens mijn moeder. Hij heeft mij noch een onderdrukker, noch een slecht mens gemaakt."
null.verse 19:33: "Vrede was met mij op de dag van mijn geboorte en zal met mij zijn op de dag van mijn dood en evenzo op de dag dat ik ten leven zal worden opgewekt."
null.verse 19:34: Aldus was Jezus, de zoon van Maria. En (dit is) het ware woord waaraan zij twijfelen.
null.verse 19:35: Het past niet bij God Zich een zoon te verwekken, Heilig is Hij. Wanneer Hij een beslissing neemt, zegt Hij daartoe slechts: "Wees", en het "is".
null.verse 19:36: "Voorwaar, God is mijn Heer en uw Heer. Aanbidt Hem derhalve, dit is de rechte weg."
null.verse 19:37: Doch (sommige) partijen verschillen (hierover) onderling van mening; maar wee de ongelovigen bij hun aanwezigheid op de grote Dag.
null.verse 19:38: Hoe helder zal hun horen en hun zien zijn op die Dag wanneer zij tot Ons zullen komen. Waarlijk, de onrechtvaardigen zijn in duidelijke dwaling.
null.verse 19:39: En waarschuw hen voor de Dag der Smart wanneer het oordeel zal worden geveld. Thans zijn zij achteloos en geloven niet.
null.verse 19:40: Wij zijn het, Die de aarde en alles wat zich daarop bevindt zullen erven en tot Ons zullen zij worden teruggebracht.
null.verse 19:41: En vermeld Abraham in het Boek. Hij was een waarheidslievend profeet.
null.verse 19:42: Toen hij tot zijn vader Sprak: "O mijn vader, waarom aanbidt je hetgeen hoort noch ziet, noch u op enigerlei wijze kan baten?"
null.verse 19:43: "O mijn vader, er is inderdaad kennis tot mij gekomen die niet tot u is gekomen, volg mij daarom, ik zal u naar een pad leiden dat effen en recht is."
null.verse 19:44: "O mijn vader, dien Satan niet want Satan is weerspannig tegen de Barmhartige;"
null.verse 19:45: "O mijn vader, ik vrees dat de straf van de Barmhartige u zal treffen en dat gij dan een gezel van Satan zult worden,"
null.verse 19:46: Antwoordde hij: "Verzaakt gij mijn goden, o Abraham? Indien gij niet ophoudt, zal ik u zeker uitbannen. Laat mij een tijd met rust."
null.verse 19:47: Abraham Sprak: "Vrede zij met u. Ik zal mijn Heer om vergiffenis voor u smeken. Hij is mij inderdaad genadig."
null.verse 19:48: "En ik zal mij verre houden van u en van hetgeen je nevens God aanroept, en ik zal tot mijn Heer bidden; waarschijnlijk zal ik in mijn gebed tot mijn Heer niet worden teleurgesteld."
null.verse 19:49: Toen hij zich van hen en van hetgeen zij nevens God aanbaden, had losgemaakt, schonken Wij hem Isaäc en Jacob en maakten elk hunner profeet.
null.verse 19:50: En Wij schonken hun Onze barmhartigheid en een verheven en goede naam.
null.verse 19:51: En vermeld Mozes in het Boek. Voorwaar hij was een uitverkorene, boodschapper en profeet.
null.verse 19:52: Wij riepen hem van de rechter zijde van de Berg (Sinaï), en deden hem tot Ons naderen om met hem te spreken.
null.verse 19:53: En Wij schonken hem, door Onze barmhartigheid zijn broeder Aäron als profeet en helper.
null.verse 19:54: En gedenk Ismaël in het Boek. Hij was getrouw aan zijn belofte En hij was (eveneens) een boodschapper - profeet.
null.verse 19:55: Hij placht zijn volk gebeden en aalmoezen aan te bevelen en zijn Heer had welbehagen in hem.
null.verse 19:56: En vermeld Idries in het Boek Hij was een waarheidslievend profeet.
null.verse 19:57: En Wij verhieven hem tot een hoge plaats.
null.verse 19:58: Dezen zijn het over wie God Zijn zegeningen heeft uitgestort; namelijk de profeten van het nageslacht van Adam en van degenen die Wij met Noach droegen (in de ark) en van het nageslacht van Abraham en Israël; en zij behoren tot degenen die Wij leidden en uitverkoren. Toen de tekenen van de Weldadige hun werden voorgelezen vielen zij buigend en wenend neder.
null.verse 19:59: Hen volgden de bozen op, die het gebed verwaarloosden, en hun hartstochten gehoor gaven. Weldra zullen zij hun ondergang tegemoet gaan.
null.verse 19:60: Maar zij die berouw hebben en geloven en goede werken verrichten, zullen het paradijs binnengaan en zij zullen geenszins schade lijden.
null.verse 19:61: Tuinen der eeuwigheid, dat is een belofte van het Onzienlijke, welke de Barmhartige aan Zijn dienaren heeft gedaan. Voorwaar, Zijn belofte zal zeker worden vervuld.
null.verse 19:62: Zij zullen daarin geen ijdel gesprek horen: slechts "vrede", en ’s morgens en ’s avonds zullen zij hun levensonderhoud ontvangen.
null.verse 19:63: Aldus is het paradijs dat Wij als erfenis geven aan Onze dienaren, die rechtvaardig zijn.
null.verse 19:64: "Wij (engelen) dalen slechts neder op bevel van uw Heer. Aan Hem behoort al hetgeen vóór ons is en al hetgeen achter ons is en al hetgeen er tussen ligt; en uw Heer vergeet nimmer."
null.verse 19:65: Hij is de Heer der hemelen en der aarde en al hetgeen hier tussen is. Dien Hem derhalve en wees volhardend in Zijn aanbidding. Kent gij Zijn gelijke?
null.verse 19:66: En de mens zegt: "Zal ik wanneer ik dood ben, dan tot leven worden terug gebracht?"
null.verse 19:67: Herinnert de mens zich dan niet dat Wij hem voorheen hebben geschapen toen hij nog niets was?
null.verse 19:68: En bij uw Heer, Wij zullen hen en de duivelen zeker verzamelen: dan zullen Wij hen op de knieën rondom de hel plaatsen.
null.verse 19:69: Dan zullen Wij zeker uit elke groep diegenen onder hen uitkiezen die het opstandigst waren tegen de Weldadige.
null.verse 19:70: En voorzeker, Wij weten het best wie onder hen het meest verdienen daarin te branden.
null.verse 19:71: Er is niemand onder u of hij zal er toe komen - dit is een door uw Heer vastgesteld besluit.
null.verse 19:72: Dan zullen Wij de rechtvaardigen redden en de bozen op hun knieën daarin achterlaten.
null.verse 19:73: En wanneer Onze duidelijke tekenen aan hen worden voorgehouden zeggen de ongelovigen tot de gelovigen: "Welke van de twee partijen neemt de beste plaats in en welke is beter als kring?"
null.verse 19:74: Hoevele geslachten hebben Wij niet vóór hen verdelgd, die een groter bezit hadden en een beter uiterlijk!
null.verse 19:75: Zeg: "De Weldadige geeft degenen die dwalen uitstel totdat zij zullen zien hetgeen waarmee zij worden bedreigd, - zij het de kastijding of het Uur - daarna zullen zij weten wie de slechtste plaats inneemt en wie zwakkere strijdkrachten heeft.
null.verse 19:76: En God vermeerdert leiding voor degenen die leiding volgen. De blijvende goede werken geven een betere beloning en (vormen) de beste toevlucht bij uw Heer.
null.verse 19:77: Hebt gij hem dan gezien die Onze tekenen verwerpt en zegt: "Mij zullen zeker rijkdommen en kinderen worden geschonken?"
null.verse 19:78: Heeft hij toegang tot het Onzienlijke gehad of heeft hij een belofte uit de hand van de Weldadige ontvangen?
null.verse 19:79: Neen, hetgeen hij zegt tekenen Wij aan en Wij zullen de straf voor hem vermeerderen.
null.verse 19:80: En Wij zullen al hetgeen waarover hij spreekt erven en hij zal alleen tot Ons komen.
null.verse 19:81: Zij hebben andere goden naast God genomen, opdat dezen een bron van macht voor hen mogen zijn.
null.verse 19:82: Stellig niet! Integendeel zij (de afgoden) zullen hun aanbidding ontkennen en hun tegenstanders blijken te zijn.
null.verse 19:83: Ziet gij niet dat Wij duivelen over de ongelovigen hebben losgelaten om hen aan te sporen?
null.verse 19:84: Wees daarom niet gehaast tegenover hen, Wij zullen voor hen de juiste (vergelding) voorbereiden.
null.verse 19:85: Ten dage waarop Wij de godvrezenden in groepen zullen verzamelen tot de Barmhartige.
null.verse 19:86: Zullen Wij de schuldigen als een dorstige kudde naar de hel drijven.
null.verse 19:87: Zij zullen geen voorspraak hebben behalve degenen die van de Weldadige een belofte hebben ontvangen.
null.verse 19:88: En zij zeggen: "De Barmhartige heeft zich een zoon genomen."
null.verse 19:89: Gij hebt voorzeker een lastering uitgesproken.
null.verse 19:90: De hemelen dreigen vaneen te scheuren, en de aarde te splijten en de bergen in stukken te vallen.
null.verse 19:91: Daar zij aan de Barmhartige een zoon hebben toegekend.
null.verse 19:92: Terwijl de Barmhartige te verheven is om een zoon te hebben.
null.verse 19:93: Er is niemand in de hemelen en op de aarde die niet als een dienaar tot de Barmhartige zal komen.
null.verse 19:94: Voorwaar, Hij kent hen en heeft hen allen precies geteld.
null.verse 19:95: En op de Dag der Opstanding zal elk hunner alleen tot Hem komen.
null.verse 19:96: Degenen die geloven en goede daden doen - aan hen zal de Barmhartige liefde betonen.
null.verse 19:97: Aldus hebben Wij hem (de Koran) gemakkelijk voor uw tong gemaakt, opdat je er mede goede tijdingen aan de godvruchtigen moogt geven en een twistziek volk er door moogt waarschuwen.
null.verse 19:98: EEn hoevele geslachten hebben Wij vóór hen niet vernietigd? Kunt gij een enkeling hunner zien of een voetstap van hen horen?

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:2: A mention of the mercy of thy Lord unto His servant Zachariah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:3: When he cried unto his Lord a cry in secret,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:4: Saying: My Lord! Lo! the bones of me wax feeble and my head is shining with grey hair, and I have never been unblest in prayer to Thee, my Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:5: Lo! I fear my kinsfolk after me, since my wife is barren. Oh, give me from Thy presence a successor
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:6: Who shall inherit of me and inherit (also) of the house of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, acceptable (unto Thee).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:7: (It was said unto him): O Zachariah! Lo! We bring thee tidings of a son whose name is John; we have given the same name to none before (him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:8: He said: My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:9: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me, even as I created thee before, when thou wast naught.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:10: He said: My Lord! Appoint for me some token. He said: Thy token is that thou, with no bodily defect, shalt not speak unto mankind three nights.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:11: Then he came forth unto his people from the sanctuary, and signified to them: Glorify your Lord at break of day and fall of night.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:12: (And it was said unto his son): O John! Hold fast the Scripture. And we gave him wisdom when a child,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:13: And compassion from Our presence, and purity; and he was devout,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:14: And dutiful toward his parents. And he was not arrogant, rebellious.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:15: Peace on him the day he was born, and the day he dieth and the day he shall be raised alive!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:16: And make mention of Mary in the Scripture, when she had withdrawn from her people to a chamber looking East,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:17: And had chosen seclusion from them. Then We sent unto her Our Spirit and it assumed for her the likeness of a perfect man.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:18: She said: Lo! I seek refuge in the Beneficent One from thee, if thou art God-fearing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:19: He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on thee a faultless son.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:20: She said: How can I have a son when no mortal hath touched me, neither have I been unchaste ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:21: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me. And (it will be) that We may make of him a revelation for mankind and a mercy from Us, and it is a thing ordained.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:22: And she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a far place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:23: And the pangs of childbirth drove her unto the trunk of the palm-tree. She said: Oh, would that I had died ere this and had become a thing of naught, forgotten!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:24: Then (one) cried unto her from below her, saying: Grieve not! Thy Lord hath placed a rivulet beneath thee,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:25: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree toward thee, thou wilt cause ripe dates to fall upon thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:26: So eat and drink and be consoled. And if thou meetest any mortal, say: Lo! I have vowed a fast unto the Beneficent, and may not speak this day to any mortal.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:27: Then she brought him to her own folk, carrying him. They said: O Mary! Thou hast come with an amazing thing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:28: O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a wicked man nor was thy mother a harlot.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:29: Then she pointed to him. They said: How can we talk to one who is in the cradle, a young boy ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:30: He spake: Lo! I am the slave of Allah. He hath given me the Scripture and hath appointed me a Prophet,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:31: And hath made me blessed wheresoever I may be, and hath enjoined upon me prayer and almsgiving so long as I remain alive,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:32: And (hath made me) dutiful toward her who bore me, and hath not made me arrogant, unblest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:33: Peace on me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be raised alive!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:34: Such was Jesus, son of Mary: (this is) a statement of the truth concerning which they doubt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:35: It befitteth not (the Majesty of) Allah that He should take unto Himself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decreeth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:36: And lo! Allah is my Lord and your Lord. So serve Him. That is the right path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:37: The sects among them differ: but woe unto the disbelievers from the meeting of an awful Day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:38: See and hear them on the Day they come unto Us! yet the evil-doers are to-day in error manifest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:39: And warn them of the Day of anguish when the case hath been decided. Now they are in a state of carelessness, and they believe not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:40: Lo! We, only We, inherit the earth and all who are thereon, and unto Us they are returned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:41: And make mention (O Muhammad) in the Scripture of Abraham. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:42: When he said unto his father: O my father! Why worshippest thou that which heareth not nor seeth, nor can in aught avail thee ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:43: O my father! Lo! there hath come unto me of knowledge that which came not unto thee. So follow me, and I will lead thee on a right path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:44: O my father! Serve not the devil. Lo! the devil is a rebel unto the Beneficent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:45: O my father! Lo! I fear lest a punishment from the Beneficent overtake thee so that thou become a comrade of the devil.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:46: He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham ? If thou cease not, I shall surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:47: He said: Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee. Lo! He was ever gracious unto me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:48: I shall withdraw from you and that unto which ye pray beside Allah, and I shall pray unto my Lord. It may be that, in prayer unto my Lord, I shall not be unblest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:49: So, when he had withdrawn from them and that which they were worshipping beside Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob. Each of them We made a prophet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:50: And we gave them of Our mercy, and assigned to them a high and true renown.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:51: And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:52: We called him from the right slope of the Mount, and brought him nigh in communion.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:53: And We bestowed upon him of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet (likewise).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:54: And make mention in the Scripture of Ishmael. Lo! he was a keeper of his promise, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:55: He enjoined upon his people worship and almsgiving, and was acceptable in the sight of his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:56: And make mention in the Scripture of Idris. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:57: And We raised him to high station.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:58: These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring and weeping.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:59: Now there hath succeeded them a later generation whom have ruined worship and have followed lusts. But they will meet deception.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:60: Save him who shall repent and believe and do right. Such will enter the Garden, and they will not be wronged in aught -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:61: Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent hath promised to His slaves in the unseen. Lo! His promise is ever sure of fulfilment -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:62: They hear therein no idle talk, but only Peace; and therein they have food for morn and evening.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:63: Such is the Garden which We cause the devout among Our bondmen to inherit.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:64: We (angels) come not down save by commandment of thy Lord. Unto Him belongeth all that is before us and all that is behind us and all that is between those two, and thy Lord was never forgetful -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:65: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them! Therefor, worship thou Him and be thou steadfast in His service. Knowest thou one that can be named along with Him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:66: And man saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth alive ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:67: Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was naught ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:68: And, by thy Lord, verily We shall assemble them and the devils, then We shall bring them, crouching, around hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:69: Then We shall pluck out from every sect whichever of them was most stubborn in rebellion to the Beneficent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:70: And surely We are Best Aware of those most worthy to be burned therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:71: There is not one of you but shall approach it. That is a fixed ordinance of thy Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:72: Then We shall rescue those who kept from evil, and leave the evil-doers crouching there.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:73: And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Which of the two parties (yours or ours) is better in position, and more imposing as an army ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:74: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were more imposing in respect of gear and outward seeming!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:75: Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will verily prolong his span of life until, when they behold that which they were promised, whether it be punishment (in the world), or the Hour (of doom), they will know who is worse in position and who is weaker as an army.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:76: Allah increaseth in right guidance those who walk aright, and the good deeds which endure are better in thy Lord’s sight for reward, and better for resort.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:77: Hast thou seen him who disbelieveth in Our revelations and saith: Assuredly I shall be given wealth and children ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:78: Hath he perused the Unseen, or hath he made a pact with the Beneficent ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:79: Nay, but We shall record that which he saith and prolong for him a span of torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:80: And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he will come unto Us, alone (without his wealth and children).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:81: And they have chosen (other) gods beside Allah that they may be a power for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:82: Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and become opponents unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:83: Seest thou not that We have set the devils on the disbelievers to confound them with confusion ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:84: So make no haste against them (O Muhammad). We do but number unto them a sum (of days).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:85: On the day when We shall gather the righteous unto the Beneficent, a goodly company.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:86: And drive the guilty unto hell, a weary herd,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:87: They will have no power of intercession, save him who hath made a covenant with his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:88: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:89: Assuredly ye utter a disastrous thing
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:90: Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:91: That ye ascribe unto the Beneficent a son,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:92: When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He should choose a son.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:93: There is none in the heavens and the earth but cometh unto the Beneficent as a slave.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:94: Verily He knoweth them and numbereth them with (right) numbering.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:95: And each one of them will come unto Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:96: Lo! those who believe and do good works, the Beneficent will appoint for them love.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:97: And We make (this Scripture) easy in thy tongue, (O Muhammad) only that thou mayst bear good tidings therewith unto those who ward off (evil), and warn therewith the froward folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 19:98: And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Canst thou (Muhammad) see a single man of them, or hear from them the slightest sound ?

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:2: (This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His servant Zakariya.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:3: Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:4: Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones, and the hair of my head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest, O my Lord, in my prayer to Thee!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:5: "Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after me: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:6: "(One that) will (truly) represent me, and represent the posterity of Jacob; and make him, O my Lord! one with whom Thou art well-pleased!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:7: (His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of a son: His name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We conferred distinction before."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:8: He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:9: He said: "So (it will be) thy Lord saith, ’that is easy for Me: I did indeed create thee before, when thou hadst been nothing!’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:10: (Zakariya) said: "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign," was the answer, "Shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights, although thou art not dumb."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:11: So Zakariya came out to his people from him chamber: He told them by signs to celebrate God’s praises in the morning and in the evening.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:12: (To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book with might": and We gave him Wisdom even as a youth,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:13: And piety (for all creatures) as from Us, and purity: He was devout,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:14: And kind to his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:15: So Peace on him the day he was born, the day that he dies, and the day that he will be raised up to life (again)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:16: Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:17: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:18: She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (God) Most Gracious: (come not near) if thou dost fear God."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:19: He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:20: She said: "How shall I have a son, seeing that no man has touched me, and I am not unchaste?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:21: He said: "So (it will be): Thy Lord saith, ’that is easy for Me: and (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from Us’:It is a matter (so) decreed."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:22: So she conceived him, and she retired with him to a remote place.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:23: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree: She cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died before this! would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of sight!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:24: But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-tree): "Grieve not! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:25: "And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:26: "So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man, say, ’I have vowed a fast to (God) Most Gracious, and this day will I enter into not talk with any human being’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:27: At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:28: "O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:29: But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:30: He said: "I am indeed a servant of God: He hath given me revelation and made me a prophet;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:31: "And He hath made me blessed wheresoever I be, and hath enjoined on me Prayer and Charity as long as I live;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:32: "(He) hath made me kind to my mother, and not overbearing or miserable;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:33: "So peace is on me the day I was born, the day that I die, and the day that I shall be raised up to life (again)"!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:34: Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth, about which they (vainly) dispute.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:35: It is not befitting to (the majesty of) God that He should beget a son. Glory be to Him! when He determines a matter, He only says to it, "Be", and it is.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:36: Verily God is my Lord and your Lord: Him therefore serve ye: this is a Way that is straight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:37: But the sects differ among themselves: and woe to the unbelievers because of the (coming) Judgment of a Momentous Day!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:38: How plainly will they see and hear, the Day that they will appear before Us! but the unjust today are in error manifest!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:39: But warn them of the Day of Distress, when the matter will be determined: for (behold,) they are negligent and they do not believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:40: It is We Who will inherit the earth, and all beings thereon: to Us will they all be returned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:41: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:42: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:43: "O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:44: "O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (God) Most Gracious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:45: "O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (God) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:46: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:47: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:48: "And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye invoke besides God: I will call on my Lord: perhaps, by my prayer to my Lord, I shall be not unblest."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:49: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides God, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:50: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:51: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was an apostle (and) a prophet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:52: And we called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai), and made him draw near to Us, for mystic (converse).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:53: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:54: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma’il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was an apostle (and) a prophet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:55: He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity, and he was most acceptable in the sight of his Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:56: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:57: And We raised him to a lofty station.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:58: Those were some of the prophets on whom God did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (God) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:59: But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and followed after lusts soon, then, will they face Destruction,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:60: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness: for these will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:61: Gardens of Eternity, those which (God) Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must (necessarily) come to pass.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:62: They will not there hear any vain discourse, but only salutations of Peace: And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and evening.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:63: Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who guard against Evil.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:64: (The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to Him belongeth what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between: and thy Lord never doth forget,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:65: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:66: Man says: "What! When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:67: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:68: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:69: Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against (God) Most Gracious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:70: And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being burned therein.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:71: Not one of you but will pass over it: this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which must be accomplished.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:72: But We shall save those who guarded against evil, and We shall leave the wrong-doers therein, (humbled) to their knees.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:73: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, the Unbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of the two sides is best in point of position? Which makes the best show in council?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:74: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:75: Say: "If any men go astray, (God) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of God (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:76: "And God doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance: and the things that endure, Good Deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best in respect of (their) eventual return."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:77: Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs, yet says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:78: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (God) Most Gracious?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:79: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall add and add to his punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:80: To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear before Us bare and alone.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:81: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than God, to give them power and glory!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:82: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:83: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:84: So make no haste against them, for We but count out to them a (limited) number (of days).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:85: The day We shall gather the righteous to (God) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:86: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:87: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (God) Most Gracious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:88: They say: "(God) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:89: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:90: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:91: That they should invoke a son for (God) Most Gracious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:92: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (God) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:93: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (God) Most Gracious as a servant.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:94: He does take an account of them (all), and hath numbered them (all) exactly.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:95: And everyone of them will come to Him singly on the Day of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:96: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (God) Most Gracious bestow love.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:97: So have We made the (Qur’an) easy in thine own tongue, that with it thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous, and warnings to people given to contention.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 19:98: But how many (countless) generations before them have We destroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear (so much as) a whisper of them?

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:2: The mention of thy Lord’s mercy unto His servant Zachariah;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:3: when he called upon his Lord secretly
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:4: saying, ’O my Lord, behold the bones within me are feeble and my head is all aflame with hoariness. And in calling on Thee, my Lord, I have never been hitherto unprosperous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:5: And now I fear my kinsfolk after I am gone; and my wife is barren. So give me, from Thee, a kinsman
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:6: who shall be my inheritor and the inheritor of the House of Jacob; and make him, my Lord, well-pleasing.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:7: ’O Zachariah, We give thee good tidings of a boy, whose name is John. No namesake have We given him aforetime.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:8: He said, ’O my Lord, how shall I have a son, seeing my wife is barren, and I have attained to the declining of old age?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:9: Said He, ’So it shall be; thy Lord says, "Easy is that for Me, seeing that I created thee aforetime, when thou wast nothing."’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:10: He said, ’Lord, appoint to me some sign.’ Said He, ’Thy sign is that thou shall not speak to men, though being without fault, three nights.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:11: So he came forth unto his people from the Sanctuary, then he made signal to them, ’Give you glory at dawn and evening.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:12: ’O John, take the Book forcefully’; and We gave him judgment, yet a little child,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:13: and a tenderness from Us, and purity; and he was godfearing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:14: and cherishing his parents, not arrogant, rebellious.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:15: ’Peace be upon him, the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he is raised up alive!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:16: And mention in the Book Mary when she withdrew from her people to an eastern place,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:17: and she took a veil apart from them; then We sent unto her Our Spirit that presented himself to her a man without fault.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:18: She said, ’I take refuge in the All-merciful from thee!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:19: If thou fearest God ... He said, ’I am but a messenger come from thy Lord, to give thee a boy most pure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:20: She said, ’How shall I have a son whom no mortal has touched, neither have I been unchaste?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:21: He said, ’Even so thy Lord has said: "Easy is that for Me; and that We may appoint him a sign unto men and a mercy from Us; it is a thing decreed."’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:22: So she conceived him, and withdrew with him to a distant place.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:23: And the birthpangs surprised her by the trunk of the palm-tree. She said, ’Would I had died ere this, and become a thing forgotten!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:24: But the one that was below her called to her, ’Nay, do not sorrow; see, thy Lord has set below thee a rivulet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:25: Shake also to thee the palm-trunk, and there shall come tumbling upon thee dates fresh and ripe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:26: Eat therefore, and drink, and be comforted; and if thou shouldst see any mortal, say, "I have vowed to the All-merciful a fast, and today I will not speak to any man.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:27: Then she brought the child to her folk carrying him; and they said, ’Mary, thou hast surely committed a monstrous thing!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:28: Sister of Aaron, thy father was not a wicked man, nor was thy mother a woman unchaste.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:29: Mary pointed to the child then; but they said, ’How shall we speak to one who is still in the cradle, a little child?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:30: He said, ’Lo, I am God’s servant; God has given me the Book, and made me a Prophet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:31: Blessed He has made me, wherever I may be; and He has enjoined me to pray, and to give the alms, so long as I live,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:32: and likewise to cherish my mother; He has not made me arrogant, unprosperous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:33: Peace be upon me, the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I am raised up alive!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:34: That is Jesus, son of Mary, in word of truth, concerning which they are doubting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:35: It is not for God to take a son unto Him. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing, He but says to it ’Be,’ and it is.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:36: Surely God is my Lord, and your Lord; So serve you Him. This is a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:37: But the parties have fallen into variance among themselves; then woe to those who disbelieve for the scene of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:38: How well they will hear and see on the day they come to Us! But the evildoers even today are in error manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:39: Warn thou them of the day of anguish, when the matter shall be determined, and they yet heedless and unbelieving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:40: Surely We shall inherit the earth and all that are upon it, and unto Us they shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:41: And mention in the Book Abraham; surely he was a true man, a Prophet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:42: When he said to his father, ’Father, why worshippest thou that which neither hears nor sees, nor avails thee anything?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:43: Father, there has come to me knowledge such as came not to thee; so follow me, and I will guide thee on a level path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:44: Father, serve not Satan; surely Satan is a rebel against the All-merciful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:45: Father, I fear that some chastisement from the All-merciful will smite thee, so that thou becomest a friend to Satan.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:46: Said he, ’What, art thou shrinking from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if thou givest not over, I shall stone thee; so forsake me now for some while.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:47: He said, ’Peace be upon thee! I will ask my Lord to forgive thee; surely He is ever gracious to me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:48: Now I will go apart from you and that you call upon, apart from God; I will call upon my Lord, and haply I shall not be, in calling upon my Lord, unprosperous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:49: So, when he went apart from them and that they were serving, apart from God, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each We made a Prophet;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:50: and We gave them of Our mercy, and We appointed unto them a tongue of truthfulness, sublime.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:51: And mention in the Book Moses; he was devoted, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:52: We called to him from the right side Of the Mount, and We brought him near in communion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:53: And We gave him his brother Aaron, of Our mercy, a Prophet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:54: And mention in the Book Ishmael; he was true to his promise, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:55: He bade his people to pray and to give the alms, and he was pleasing to his Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:56: And mention in the Book Idris; he was a true man, a Prophet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:57: We raised him up to a high place.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:58: These are they whom God has blessed among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those We bore with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:59: Then there succeeded after them a succession who wasted the prayer, and followed lusts; so they shall encounter error
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:60: save him who repents, and believes, and does a righteous deed; those -- they shall enter Paradise, and they shall not be wronged anything;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:61: Gardens of Eden that the All-merciful promised His servants in the Unseen; His promise is ever performed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:62: There they shall hear no idle talk, but only ’Peace.’ There they shall have their provision at dawn and evening.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:63: That is Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who are godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:64: We come not down, save at the commandment of thy Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us, and all that is behind us, and all between that.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:65: And thy Lord is never forgetful, Lord He of the heavens and earth and all that is between them. So serve Him, and be thou patient in His service; knowest thou any that can be named with His Name?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:66: Man says, ’What, when I am dead shall I then be brought forth alive?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:67: Will not man remember that We created him aforetime, when he was nothing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:68: Now, by thy Lord, We shall surely muster them, and the Satans, then We shall parade them about Gehenna hobbling on their knees.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:69: Then We shall pluck forth from every party whichever of them was the most hardened in disdain of the All-merciful;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:70: then We shall know very well those most deserving to burn there.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:71: Not one of you there is, but he shall go down to it; that for thy Lord is a thing decreed, determined.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:72: Then We shall deliver those that were godfearing; and the evildoers We shall leave there, hobbling on their knees.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:73: When Our signs are recited to them as clear signs, the unbelievers say to the believers, ’Which of the two parties is better in station, fairer in assembly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:74: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were fairer in furnishing and outward show!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:75: Say: ’Whosoever is in error, let the All-merciful prolong his term for him! Till, when they see that they were threatened, whether the chastisement, or the Hour, then they shall surely know who is worse in place, and who is weaker in hosts.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:76: And God shall increase those who were guided in guidance; and the abiding things, the deeds of righteousness, are better with thy Lord in reward, and better in return
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:77: Hast thou seen him who disbelieves in Our signs and says, ’Assuredly I shall be given wealth and children’?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:78: What, has he observed the Unseen, or taken a covenant with the All-merciful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:79: No, indeed! We shall assuredly write down all that he says, and We shall prolong for him the chastisement;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:80: and We shall inherit from him that he says, and he shall come to Us alone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:81: And they have taken to them other gods apart from God, that they might be for them a might.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:82: No, indeed! They shall deny their service, and they shall be against them pitted.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:83: Hast thou not seen how We sent the Satans against the unbelievers, to prick them?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:84: So hasten thou not against them; We are only numbering for them a number.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:85: On the day that We shall muster the godfearing to the All-merciful with pomp
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:86: and drive the evildoers into Gehenna herding,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:87: having no power of intercession, save those who have taken with the All-merciful covenant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:88: And they say, ’The All-merciful has taken unto Himself a son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:89: You have indeed advanced something hideous!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:90: The heavens are wellnigh rent of it and the earth split asunder, and the mountains wellnigh fall down crashing for
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:91: that they have attributed to the All-merciful a son;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:92: and it behoves not the All-merciful to take a son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:93: None is there in the heavens and earth but he comes to the All-merciful as a servant;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:94: He has indeed counted them, and He has numbered them exactly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:95: Every one of them shall come to Him upon the Day of Resurrection, all alone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:96: Surely those who believe and do deeds of righteousness -- unto them the All-merciful shall assign love.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:97: Now We have made it easy by thy tongue that thou mayest bear good tidings thereby to the godfearing, and warn a people stubborn.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 19:98: And how many a generation We destroyed before them! Dost thou perceive so much as one of them, or hear of them a whisper?

Muhammad Asad.verse 19:2: AN ACCOUNT of the grace which thy Sustainer bestowed upon His servant Zachariah:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:3: When he called out to his Sustainer in the secrecy of his heart,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:4: he prayed: "O my Sustainer! Feeble have become my bones, and my head glistens with grey hair. But never yet, O my Lord, has my prayer unto Thee remained unanswered.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:5: "Now, behold, I am afraid of [what] my kinsfolk [will do] after I am gone, for my wife has always been barren. Bestow, then, upon me, out of Thy grace, the gift of a successor
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:6: who will be my heir as well as an heir [to the dignity] of the House of Jacob; and make him, O my Sustainer, well-pleasing to Thee!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:7: [Thereupon the angels called out unto him:] "O Zachariah! We bring thee the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son whose name shall be John. [And God says,] ‘Never have We given this name to anyone before him.’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:8: [Zachariah] exclaimed: "O my Sustainer! How can I have a son when my wife has always been barren and I have become utterly infirm through old age?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:9: Answered [the angel]: "Thus it is; [but] thy Sustainer says, ‘This is easy for Me – even as I have created thee aforetime out of nothing.’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:10: [Zachariah] prayed: "O my Sustainer! Appoint a sign for me!" Said [the angel]: "Thy sign shall be that for full three nights [and days] thou wilt not speak unto men."
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:11: Thereupon he came out of the sanctuary unto his people and signified to them [by gestures]: "Extol His limitless glory by day and by night!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:12: [And when the son was born and grew up, he was told,] "O John! Hold fast unto the divine writ with [all thy] strength!" – for We granted him wisdom while he was yet a little boy,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:13: as well as, by Our grace, [the gift of] compassion and purity; and he was [always] conscious of Us
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:14: and full of piety towards his parents; and never was he haughty or rebellious.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:15: Hence, [God’s] peace was upon him on the day when he was born, and on the day of his death, and will be [upon him] on the day when he shall be raised to life .
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:16: AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Mary. Lo! She withdrew from her family to an eastern place
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:17: and kept herself in seclusion from them, whereupon We sent unto her Our angel of revelation, who appeared to her in the shape of a well-made human being.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:18: She exclaimed: "Verily, I seek refuge from thee with the Most Gracious! [Approach me not] if thou art conscious of Him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:19: [The angel] answered: "I am but a messenger of thy Sustainer, [who says,] ‘I shall bestow upon thee the gift of a son endowed with purity.’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:20: Said she: "How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me? – for never have I been a loose woman!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:21: [The angel] answered: "Thus it is; [but] thy Sustainer says, ‘This is easy for Me; and [thou shalt have a son,] so that We might make him a symbol unto mankind and an act of grace from Us.’" And it was a thing decreed [by God]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:22: and in time she conceived him, and then she withdrew with him to a far-off place.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:23: And [when] the throes of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree, she exclaimed: "Oh, would that I had died ere this, and had become a thing forgotten, utterly forgotten!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:24: Thereupon [a voice] called out to her from beneath that [palm-tree]: "Grieve not! Thy Sustainer has provided a rivulet [running] beneath thee;
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:25: and shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards thee: it will drop fresh, ripe dates upon thee.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:26: Eat, then, and drink, and let thine eye be gladdened! And if thou shouldst see any human being, convey this unto him: ‘Behold, abstinence from speech have I vowed unto the Most Gracious; hence, I may not speak today to any mortal.’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:27: And in time she returned to her people, carrying the child with her. They said: "O Mary! Thou hast indeed done an amazing thing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:28: O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a wicked man, nor was thy mother a loose woman!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:29: Thereupon she pointed to him. They exclaimed: "How can we talk to one who [as yet] is a little boy in the cradle?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:30: [But] he said: "Behold, I am a servant of God. He has vouchsafed unto me revelation and made me a prophet,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:31: and made me blessed wherever I may be; and He has enjoined upon me prayer and charity as long as I live,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:32: and [has endowed me with] piety towards my mother; and He has not made me haughty or bereft of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:33: "Hence, peace was upon me on the day when I was born, and [will be upon me] on the day of my death, and on the day when I shall be raised to life !"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:34: SUCH WAS, in the words of truth, Jesus the son of Mary, about whose nature they so deeply disagree.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:35: It is not conceivable that God should have taken unto Himself a son: limitless is He in His glory! When He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it "Be" – and it is!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:36: And [thus it was that Jesus always said]: "Verily, God is my Sustainer as well as your Sustainer; so worship [none but] Him: this [alone] is a straight way."
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:37: And yet, the sects [that follow the Bible] are at variance among themselves [about the nature of Jesus]! Woe, then, unto all who deny the truth when that awesome Day will appear!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:38: How well will they hear and see [the truth] on the Day when they come before Us! Today, however, these evildoers are obviously lost in error:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:39: hence, warn them of [the coming of] the Day of Regrets, when everything will have been decided – for as yet they are heedless, and they do not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:40: Behold, We alone shall remain after the earth and all who live on it have passed away, and [when] unto Us all will have been brought back.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:41: AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Abraham. Behold, he was a man of truth, [already] a prophet
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:42: when he spoke [thus] unto his father: "O my father! Why dost thou worship something that neither hears nor sees and can be of no avail whatever to thee?
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:43: "O my father! Behold, there has indeed come to me [a ray] of knowledge such as has never yet come unto thee: follow me, then; I shall guide thee onto a perfect way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:44: "O my father! Do not worship Satan – for, verily, Satan is a rebel against the Most Gracious!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:45: O my father! I dread lest a chastisement from the Most Gracious befall thee, and then thou wilt become [aware of having been] close unto Satan!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:46: He answered: "Dost thou dislike my gods, O Abraham? Indeed, if thou desist not, I shall most certainly cause thee to be stoned to death! Now begone from me for good!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:47: [Abraham] replied: "Peace be upon thee! I shall ask my Sustainer to forgive thee: for, behold, He has always been kind unto me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:48: But I shall withdraw from you all and from whatever you invoke instead of God, and shall invoke my Sustainer [alone]: it may well be that my prayer [for thee] will not remain unanswered by my Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:49: And after he had withdrawn from them and from all that they were worshipping instead of God, We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and made of them a prophet;
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:50: We bestowed upon them [manifold] gifts out of Our grace, and granted them a lofty power to convey the truth [unto others].
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:51: AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Moses. Behold, he was a chosen one, and was an apostle [of God], a prophet.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:52: And [remember how] We called upon him from the right-hand slope of Mount Sinai and drew him near [unto Us] in mystic communion,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:53: and [how], out of Our grace, We granted unto him his brother Aaron, to be a prophet [by his side].
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:54: AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Ishmael. Behold, he was always true to his promise, and was an apostle [of God], a prophet,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:55: who used to enjoin upon his people prayer and charity, and found favour in his Sustainer’s sight.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:56: AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Idrīs. Behold, he was a man of truth, a prophet,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:57: whom We exalted onto a lofty station.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:58: THESE WERE some of the prophets upon whom God bestowed His blessings – [prophets] of the seed of Adam and of those whom We caused to be borne [in the ark] with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel: and [all of them were] among those whom We had guided and elected; [and] whenever the messages of the Most Gracious were conveyed unto them, they would fall down [before Him], prostrating themselves and weeping.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:59: Yet they were succeeded by generations [of people] who lost all [thought of] prayer and followed [but] their own lusts; and these will, in time, meet with utter disillusion.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:60: Excepted, however, shall be those who repent and attain to faith and do righteous deeds: for it is they who will enter paradise and will not be wronged in any way:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:61: [theirs will be the] gardens of perpetual bliss which the Most Gracious has promised unto His servants, in a realm which is beyond the reach of human perception: [and,] verily, His promise is ever sure of fulfilment!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:62: No empty talk will they hear there – nothing but [tidings of] inner soundness and peace; and there will they have their sustenance by day and by night:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:63: this is the paradise which We grant as heritage unto such of Our servants as are conscious of Us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:64: AND [the angels say]: "We do not descend [with revelation], again and again, other than by thy Sustainer’s command: unto Him belongs all that lies open before us and all that is hidden from us and all that in-between. And never does thy Sustainer forget
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:65: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them! Worship, then, Him alone, and remain steadfast in His worship! Dost thou know any whose name is worthy to be mentioned side by side with His?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:66: WITH ALL THIS, man [often] says, "What! Once I am dead, shall I again be brought forth alive?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:67: But does man not bear in mind that We have created him aforetime out of nothing?
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:68: And so, by thy Sustainer, [on Judgment Day] We shall most certainly bring them forth together with the satanic forces [which impelled them in life], and then We shall most certainly gather them, on their knees, around hell;
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:69: and thereupon We shall, indeed, draw forth from every group [of sinners] the ones that had been most determined in their disdainful rebellion against the Most Gracious:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:70: for, indeed, We know best as to which of then is most deserving of the fires of hell.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:71: And every one of you will come within sight of it: this is, with thy Sustainer, a decree that must be fulfilled.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:72: And once again: We shall save [from hell] those who have been conscious of Us; but We shall leave in it the evildoers, on their knees.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:73: AS IT IS, whenever Our messages are conveyed to them in all their clarity, those who are bent on denying the truth are wont to say unto those who have attained to faith: "which of the two kinds of man is in stronger position and superior as a community?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:74: And yet, how many a generation have We destroyed before their time – [people] who surpassed them in material power and in outward show!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:75: Say: "As for him who lives in error, may the Most Gracious lengthen the span of his life!" [And let them say whatever they say] until the time when they behold that [doom] of which they were forewarned – whether it be suffering [in this world] or [at the coming of] the Last Hour: for then they will understand which [of the two kinds of man] was worse in station and weaker in resources!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:76: And God endows those who avail themselves of [His] guidance with an ever-deeper consciousness of the right way; and good deeds, the fruit whereof endures forever, are, in thy Sustainer’s sight, of far greater merit [than any worldly goods], and yield far better returns.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:77: And hast thou ever considered [the kind of man] who is bent on denying the truth of Our messages and says, "I will surely be given wealth and children"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:78: Has he, perchance, attained to a realm which is beyond the reach of a created being’s perception? – or has he concluded a covenant with the Most Gracious?
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:79: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall lengthen the length of his suffering [in the hereafter],
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:80: and divest him of all that he is [now] speaking of: for [on Judgment Day] he will appear before Us in a lonely state.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:81: For [such as] these have taken to worshipping deities other than God, hoping that they would be a [source of] strength for them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:82: But nay! [On Judgment Day] these [very objects of adoration] will disavow the worship that was paid to them, and will turn against those [who had worshipped them]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:83: ART THOU NOT aware that We have let loose all [manner of] satanic forces upon those who deny the truth – [forces] that impel them [towards sin] with strong impulsion?
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:84: Hence, be not in haste [to call down God’s punishment] upon them: for We but number the number of their days.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:85: On the Day when We shall gather the God-conscious unto [Us,] the Most Gracious, as honoured guests,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:86: and drive those who were lost in sin unto hell as a thirsty herd is driven to a well
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:87: [on that Day] none will have [the benefit of] intercession unless he has [in his lifetime] entered into a bond with the Most Gracious.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:88: As it is, some assert, "The Most Gracious has taken unto Himself a son"!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:89: Indeed, [by this assertion] you have brought forth something monstrous,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:90: whereat the heavens might well-nigh be rent into fragments, and the earth be split asunder, and the mountains fall down in ruins!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:91: That men should ascribe a son to the Most Gracious,
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:92: although it is inconceivable that the Most Gracious should take unto Himself a son!
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:93: Not one of all [the beings] that are in the heavens or on earth appears before the Most Gracious other than as a servant:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:94: indeed, He has full cognizance of them, and has numbered them with [unfailing] numbering;
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:95: and every one of them will appear before Him on Resurrection Day in a lonely state.
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:96: VERILY, those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds will the Most Gracious endow with love:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:97: and only to this end have We made this [divine writ] easy to understand, in thine own tongue, [O Prophet,] so that thou might convey thereby a glad tiding to the God-conscious, and warn thereby those who are given to [futile] contention:
Muhammad Asad.verse 19:98: for how many a generation have We destroyed before their time – [and] canst thou perceive any one of them [now], or hear any whisper of them?

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:2: This is a narration of your Lord’s mercy to His servant Zakariyyā,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:3: When he called his Lord in a low voice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:4: He said, “My Lord, I am in a state that bones in my body have turned feeble, and the head has flared up grey with old age, and I never remained, My Lord, unanswered in my prayer to You.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:5: I fear (my) kinsmen after me, and my wife is barren, so bless me with an heir, from Your own side,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:6: who inherits me and inherits the house of Ya‘qūb. And make him, My Lord, a favourite one.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:7: (Allah said) “O Zakariyyā, We give you the good news of a boy whose name is YaHyā. We did not create any one before him of the same name.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:8: He Said, “My Lord, how shall there be a boy for me while my wife is barren, and I have reached the extreme of old age?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:9: He said, “So it is; your Lord said ‘it is easy for Me, and I did create you before, when you were nothing.’”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:10: He said, “My Lord, make for me a sign.” He said, “Your sign is that you will not (be able to) speak to the people for three (consecutive) nights, even though you will be sound in health.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:11: Then he came out to his people from the place of prayer, and directed them by gestures to proclaim the purity of Allah at morning and evening.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:12: (When the child was born, Allah said to him,) “O YaHyā, hold on to the Book firmly.” And We gave him wisdom, while he was still a child,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:13: and (blessed him with) love from our own, and purity; and he was God-fearing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:14: and he was good to his parents; and he was not oppressive (or) disobedient.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:15: Peace on him the day he was born, the day he dies and the day he will be raised alive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:16: And mention in the Book (the story of) Maryam, when she secluded herself from her people to a place towards East,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:17: then she used a barrier to hide herself from them. Then, We sent to her Our Spirit, (Jibra’īl) and he took before her the form of a perfect human being.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:18: She said, “I seek refuge with the All-Merciful (Allah) against you, if you are God-fearing.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:19: He said, “I am but a message-bearer of your Lord (sent) to give you a boy, purified.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:20: She said, “How shall I have a boy while no human has ever touched me, nor have I ever been unchaste?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:21: He said, “So it is; your Lord said, ‘It is easy for Me, and (We will do this) so that We make it a sign for people and a mercy from Us, and this is a matter already destined.’”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:22: So she conceived him, and went in seclusion with him to a remote place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:23: Then the labour pains brought her to the trunk of a palm-tree. She said “O that I would have died before this, and would have been something gone, forgotten.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:24: Then he called her from beneath her: “Do not grieve; your Lord has placed a stream beneath you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:25: Shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards yourself and, it will drop upon you ripe fresh dates.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:26: So eat, drink and cool your eyes. Then if you see any human being, say (to him), “I have vowed a fast (of silence) for the All-Merciful (Allah,) and therefore, I shall never speak to any human today.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:27: Then she came to her people carrying him (the baby). They said, “O Maryam you have committed something grave indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:28: O sister of Hārūn, neither your father was a man of evil nor was your mother unchaste.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:29: So, she pointed towards him (the baby). They said, “How shall we speak to someone who is still a child in the cradle?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:30: Spoke he (the baby), “Verily I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Book, and made me a prophet,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:31: and He has made me a blessed one wherever I be, and has enjoined Salāh and Zakāh upon me as long as I am alive,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:32: and (He has made me) good to my mother, and he did not make me oppressive (or) ill-fated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:33: And peace is upon me the day I was born, the day I shall die, and the day I shall be raised alive again.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:34: That is ‘Īsā, the son of Maryam, to say the truth in which they (Christians) are disputing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:35: It is not for Allah to have a son. Pure is He. When He decides a thing, He simply says to it, “Be” and it comes to be.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:36: And (O Prophet, say to the people,) “Allah is surely my Lord and your Lord. So, worship Him. This is the straight path.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:37: Then the groups among them fell in dispute. So, how evil is the fate of the disbelievers when they have to face the Great Day.
