Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:38: How strong will their hearing be, and how strong their vision, the day they will come to Us! But today the transgressors are straying in clear error.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:39: Warn them of The Day of Remorse when the whole thing will be settled, while they are heedless and do not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:40: Surely We, only We, shall be the ultimate owner of the earth and all those on it, and to Us they will be returned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:41: And mention in the Book (the story of) Ibrāhīm. Indeed, he was Siddīq (a man of truth), a prophet,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:42: when he said to his father, “My dear father, why do you worship something that does neither hear nor see, nor help you in any way?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:43: My dear father, indeed there has come to me a knowledge that has not come to you; so, follow me, and I shall lead you to a straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:44: My dear father, do not worship the Satan. The Satan is surely rebellious to the All-Merciful, (Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:45: My dear father, I fear lest a punishment from the All- Merciful (Allah) should afflict you, and you become a companion of Satan.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:46: He said, “Are you averse to my gods O Ibrāhīm? Should you not stop, I will definitely stone you. And leave me for good.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:47: He said, “Peace on you. I shall seek forgiveness for you from my Lord. He has always been gracious to me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:48: And I go away from you and what you invoke besides Allah. And I shall invoke my Lord. Hopefully I shall not be a looser by invoking my Lord.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:49: So, when he went away from them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We blessed him with IsHāq (Isaac) and Ya‘qūb (Jacob) and We made each one of them a prophet,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:50: and We bestowed on them (a great deal) of our mercy, and caused them to have a good name at a high level.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:51: And mention in the Book (the story of) Mūsā. Indeed he was a chosen one and was a messenger, a prophet.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:52: And We called him from the right side of the mount Tūr (Sinai), and We brought him close to communicate in secret.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:53: And, out of Our mercy, We granted him his brother Hārūn as a prophet.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:54: And mention in the Book (the story of) Ismā‘īl. He was indeed true to his promise, and was a messenger, a prophet.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:55: He used to enjoin Salāh and Zakāh upon his family, and was favourite to his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:56: And mention in the Book (the story of) Idrīs. He was indeed a Siddīq (man of truth), a prophet.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:57: We raised him to a high place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:58: Those are the people whom Allah has blessed with bounties, the prophets from the progeny of ’Ādam, and of those whom We caused to board (the Ark) along with NūH, and from the progeny of Ibrāhīm and Isrā’īl (Jacob), and from those whom We guided and selected. When the verses of The RaHmān (The All-Merciful) were recited before them, they used to fall down in Sajdah (prostration), while they were weeping.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:59: Then came after them the successors who neglected Salāh and followed (their selfish) desires. So they will soon face (the outcome of their) deviation,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:60: except those who repent and believe and do good deeds, and therefore they will enter the Paradise and will not be wronged at all.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:61: (They will enter) the Gardens of eternity, promised by the All-Merciful (Allah) to His servants, in the unseen world. They will surely reach (the places of) His promise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:62: They will not hear anything absurd therein, but a word of peace, and there they will have their provision at morn and eve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:63: That is the Paradise We will give as inheritance to those of Our servants who have been God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:64: (Jibra’īl X said to the Holy Prophet) “We do not descend but with the command of your Lord. To Him belongs what is in front of us and what is behind us and what is in between; and your Lord is not the One who forgets.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:65: (He is) the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever lies between them. So, worship Him and persevere in His worship. Do you know any one worthy of His name?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:66: Man says, “Is it that, once I die, I shall be brought forth alive?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:67: Does not the man remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:68: So, by your Lord, We will definitely gather them together, and the devils as well; then We will definitely make them present around the Jahannam , fallen on their knees.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:69: Then, out of every group, We will certainly draw out those who were more rebellious against the All-Merciful (Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:70: Then of course, We are most aware of those who are more deserving to enter it (the Jahannam ).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:71: There is none among you who does not have to arrive at it. This is undertaken by your Lord as an absolute decree, bound to be enforced.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:72: Then We will save those who feared Allah, and will leave the wrongdoers in it, fallen on their knees.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:73: When Our verses are recited to them in all their clarity, the disbelievers say to the believers, “Which of the two groups is superior in its place and better in its assembly?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:74: How many a generation We have destroyed before them who were better in assets and outlook!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:75: Say, “Whoever stays straying, let his term be extended by the All-Merciful (Allah) still longer, until when they will see what they are being warned of: either the punishment or the Hour (of Doom), then they will know who was worse in his place and weaker in his forces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:76: Allah makes those on the right path excel in guidance. And the everlasting virtues are better with your Lord in respect of reward and better in their return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:77: Have you, then, seen him who rejected Our verses and said, “I shall certainly be given wealth and children”?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:78: Has he peeped into the Unseen or taken a covenant with the All-Merciful (Allah)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:79: Never! We will write what he says and extend for him the punishment extensively.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:80: And We will inherit from him what he is talking about, and he will come to Us all alone.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:81: They have taken gods other than Allah, so that they may be a source of might for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:82: Never! They (their fabricated deities) will soon reject their having worshipped them, and they will be just the opposite for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:83: Have you not seen that We have sent the devils onto the disbelievers inciting them with all their incitements.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:84: So make no hurry about them; We are but counting for them a count down.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:85: The day We will assemble the God-fearing before the All-Merciful (Allah) as guests,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:86: and will drive the sinners towards the Jahannam as herds of cattle (are driven) towards water,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:87: none will have power to intercede, except the one who has entered into a covenant with the All-Merciful (Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:88: They say, “The All-Merciful (Allah) has got a son.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:89: Indeed you have come up with such an abominable statement
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:90: that the heavens are well-nigh to explode at it, and the earth to burst apart, and the mountains to fall down crumbling,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:91: for they have ascribed a son to the All-Merciful (Allah),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:92: while it does not behove the All-Merciful to have a son.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:93: There is none in the heavens and the earth, but bound to come to the All-Merciful as a salve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:94: He has fully encompassed them and precisely calculated their numbers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:95: and each one of them is bound to come to Him on the Day of Judgment, all alone.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:96: Surely, those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them the All-Merciful (Allah) will create love.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:97: So We have made it (the Qur’ān) easy through your tongue, so that you give with it the good news to the God-fearing, and warn with it an obstinate people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 19:98: And how many a generation We have destroyed before them! Do you sense (the presence of) any one of them, or hear from them even a whisper?

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:2: A mention of your Lord's mercy to His servant Zachariah,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:3: when he called out to his Lord a call in secret.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:4: He said, 'My Lord, truly the bones within me have become feeble, and my head is alight with grey hair, and I have never been in my supplications to You, my Lord, unsuccessful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:5: And truly I fear my kinsfolk after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me from Yourself a successor,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:6: who may inherit from me and inherit from the House of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, acceptable'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:7: 'O Zachariah! Indeed We give you good tidings of a boy, whose name is John. Never before have We made anyone his namesake'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:8: He said, 'My Lord, how shall I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:9: He said, 'It shall be so! Your Lord says, "It is easy for Me, for I certainly created you before when you were nothing" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:10: He said, 'Lord, appoint for me some sign'. Said He, 'Your sign is that you shall not speak to people for three nights, while [you are] in sound health'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:11: So he emerged before his people from the sanctuary and signalled to them, 'Make glorifications at morning and evening'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:12: O John! Hold on to the Scripture firmly'. And We gave him judgement, while still a child,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:13: and compassion from Us, and purity, and he was God-fearing,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:14: and dutiful to his parents. And he was not arrogant or rebellious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:15: 'And peace be upon him, the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he shall be raised alive!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:16: And mention in the Book Mary when she withdrew from her family to an easterly place.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:17: Thus she veiled herself from them, whereupon We sent to her Our Spirit, and he assumed before her the likeness of a well-proportioned human.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:18: She said, 'Lo! I seek refuge in the Compassionate One from you! If you fear God'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:19: He said, 'I am only a messenger of your Lord, that I may give you a boy [who shall be] pure'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:20: She said, 'How shall I have a boy when no human being has [ever] touched me, neither have I been unchaste?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:21: He said, 'It shall be so! Your Lord has said: "It is easy for Me, and so that We may make him a sign for mankind, and a mercy from Us. And it is a thing [already] decreed" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:22: Thus she conceived him and then withdrew with him to a distant place.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:23: And the birth pangs brought her to the trunk of the palm-tree. She said, 'O would that I had died before this and become a forgotten thing, beyond recall!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:24: Then he called her from below her, 'Do not grieve. Your Lord has made below you a rivulet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:25: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you - there will drop on you dates fresh and ripe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:26: So eat and drink, and [let] your eye be comforted; and if you [happen to] see any human being, then say, "I have vowed to the Compassionate One a fast, so I will not speak to any human today" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:27: Then, carrying him, she brought him to her folk and they said, 'O Mary, truly you have done a curious thing!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:28: O sister of Aaron your father was not a wicked man, nor was your mother unchaste'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:29: Thereat she pointed to him. They said, 'How can we talk to one who is in the cradle, [still] a little child?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:30: He said, 'Lo! I am God's servant. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:31: And He has made me blessed wherever I may be and He has enjoined upon me prayer and alms-giving, as long as I remain alive;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:32: and [He has made me] dutiful towards my mother. And He has not made me arrogant, wretched.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:33: And peace be upon me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be raised alive!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:34: ] That is Jesus, son of Mary, a statement of truth concerning which they are in doubt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:35: It is not [befitting] for God to take to Himself a son. Glory be to Him. When He decrees a thing, He only says to it, 'Be!', and it is.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:36: And indeed God is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:37: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who disbelieve at the scene of an awful Day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:38: How hearing they are and seeing on the Day when they come to Us. Yet the evildoers today are in manifest error.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:39: And warn them of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be decided, while they are [yet] heedless and do not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:40: Indeed We shall inherit the earth and all who are on it, and to Us they shall be returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:41: And mention in the Book Abraham. Indeed he was a truthful one, a prophet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:42: When he said to his father, 'O my father! Why do you worship that which neither hears nor sees, and is of no avail to you in any way?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:43: O my father! Indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you. So follow me that I may guide you to a path that is right.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:44: O my father! Do not worship Satan. Truly Satan is disobedient to the Compassionate One.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:45: O my father! I do fear lest a chastisement from the Compassionate One should befall you and then you become an ally of Satan.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:46: He said, 'Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall surely assail you; and stay away from me for a long time'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:47: He said, 'Peace be to you. I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for you. Truly He is ever gracious to me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:48: And I shall shun you and that which you call upon besides God. I will supplicate my Lord - hopefully in calling upon my Lord I shall not be wretched'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:49: And so after he had shunned them and that which they worshipped besides God, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each We made a prophet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:50: And We gave them out of Our mercy, and We assigned for them a worthy repute [one] that is lofty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:51: And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed he was devoted [to God] and he was a messenger, a prophet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:52: And We called him from the right side of the Mount and We brought him near in communion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:53: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron, [likewise] a prophet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:54: And mention in the Book Ishmael. Indeed he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger, a prophet .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:55: He used to enjoin upon his kinsfolk prayer and the [payment of] alms, and he was pleasing to his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:56: And mention in the Book Idrīs. Indeed he was a truthful one, a prophet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:57: And We raised him to a high station.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:58: Those to whom God has been gracious from among the prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham, and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose, when the signs of the Compassionate One were recited to them, they would fall down prostrating and weeping.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:59: But there succeeded after them a posterity who neglected the prayer and followed [their] lusts. So they shall [soon] encounter Ghayy;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:60: whereas those who repent and believe and act righteously - such shall enter Paradise and shall not be wronged in any way;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:61: [they shall enter] Gardens of Eden, which the Compassionate One has promised to His servants [a promise] in the Unseen. Indeed His promise is ever fulfilled.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:62: Therein they shall not hear anything that is trifling, but only [a greeting of] 'Peace!' And therein they will have their provision morning and evening.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:63: That is the Paradise which We shall give as inheritance those of Our servants who are God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:64: And We do not descend except by the commandment of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us, and all that is behind us, and all that is between those [two]. And your Lord is never forgetful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:65: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. So worship Him and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know [of] anyone who could be His namesake?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:66: And man says, 'When I am dead, shall I then be brought forth alive?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:67: Does not man then remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:68: For by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We shall bring them around Hell, crouching.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:69: Then We shall pluck out from every party whichever of them was most hardened in disdain of the Compassionate One.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:70: Then indeed We shall know best those most deserving of it for the burning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:71: There is not one of you but shall come to it. That is an inevitability [already] decreed by your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:72: Then We will deliver those who were wary and leave those who did wrong crouching therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:73: And when Our manifest signs are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'Which of the two parties is better in station and more excellent in assembly?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:74: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were superior in [their possession of] gear and in appearance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:75: Say: 'As for him who is in error, the Compassionate One shall defer him, by [granting him] some respite until when they catch sight of that which they were promised, whether it be chastisement [in this world] or the Hour. Then they will surely know who is worse in [respect of] position and weaker in [respect of the number of] hosts'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:76: And God increases in guidance those who found [right] guidance; and the enduring things, the righteous deeds are better in your Lord's sight in [terms of] reward, and better in [terms of the] return.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:77: Have you seen him who disbelieves in Our signs and says, 'I shall assuredly be given wealth and children?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:78: Has he come to learn [something] of the Unseen, or has he made a covenant with the Compassionate One?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:79: Nay, but We will assuredly write down that which he says and prolong for him the chastisement endlessly,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:80: and We shall take over from him that which he talks about, and he shall come to Us, alone.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:81: And they have taken besides God [other] gods that they may be for them a [source of] might.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:82: Nay, but they shall reject their worship, and they shall be [pitted] against them as opponents.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:83: Have you not regarded that We unleash the devils against the disbelievers to urge them impetuously?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:84: So do not make haste against them. Indeed We are only counting for them, carefully.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:85: The day on which We shall gather those who fear God, to the Compassionate One, [honoured] on mounts
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:86: and drive the guilty into Hell, a thirsty herd.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:87: They will not have the power to intercede, save him who has made a covenant with the Compassionate One.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:88: And they say, 'The Compassionate One has taken a son'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:89: Truly you have uttered something hideous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:90: The heavens are almost rent because of it and the earth [is almost] split asunder, and the mountains [almost] fall down crashing,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:91: that they have ascribed a son to the Compassionate One.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:92: When it is not meet for [the Majesty of] the Compassionate One to take a son.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:93: There is none in the heavens and the earth but he comes to the Compassionate One as a servant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:94: Verily He knows their number and has counted them precisely.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:95: And each one of them will come to Him on the Day of Resurrection, [each one] alone.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:96: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds - for them the Compassionate One shall appoint love.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:97: Indeed We have made it easy in your tongue, only that you may bear good tidings therewith to the God-fearing, and warn therewith a folk [who are] contumacious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 19:98: And how many a generation We have destroyed before them. Can you see [so much as] one of them, or hear from them [so much as] the faintest sound?

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:1: Kaf, Ha, Ya, ‘Ayn, Sad. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:2: This is an account of the mercy of your Lord (bestowed) upon His (chosen) servant Zakariyya (Zacharias),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:3: When he called upon his Lord in a low voice (charged with politeness and submissiveness).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:4: He submitted: ‘O my Lord, my bones have grown tender and (my) head has turned white like a flame due to old age and, O my Lord, I have never been unblessed when supplicating You.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:5: And I fear my (disbelieving) relatives (may ruin the blessing of Din [Religion]) after my (soul departs) and my wife (too) is barren. So bless me from Your presence with an heir (son),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:6: (The one) who should be my heir (of divine blessing), and also the heir of (the chain of Prophethood from) the Children of Ya‘qub (Jacob). And, O my Lord, (also) make him a recipient of Your Pleasure.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:7: (Allah said:) ‘O Zakariyya (Zacharias), indeed We give you the good news of a son whose name shall be Yahya (John). We have not given this name to anyone before him.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:8: (Zakariyya [Zacharias]) submitted: ‘My Lord, how can there be a son to me whilst my wife is barren, and I have shrivelled (into extreme debility) on account of old age?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:9: (He) said: ‘(Don’t be amazed.) It will be the same way.’ Your Lord said: ‘It is easy for Me (to create a son). Certainly, I created you (too) before, whilst you were (just) nothing.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:10: (Zakariyya [Zacharias]) submitted: ‘My Lord, set a sign for me.’ He said: ‘Your sign is that, despite good health, you shall not be able to speak to the people for three nights (and days).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:11: Then (Zakariyya [Zacharias]) came out from his worshipping chamber to his people and conveyed to them (i.e., made them understand) by gestures to glorify (Allah) morning and evening.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:12: O Yahya (John)! Hold fast to (Our) Book (the Torah). And We granted him wisdom and vision (i.e., Prophethood) whilst yet a child,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:13: And (blessed him) with sympathy and tenderness and purity and virtuousness from Our kind presence, and he was very Godfearing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:14: (He was) greatly righteous (and dutiful) to his parents, and was neither disobedient nor arrogant (like common boys).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:15: And peace be on Yahya (John) the day he was born, the day he dies, and the day he will be raised up alive!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:16: And, (O My Esteemed Beloved,) recite the account of Maryam (Mary) in the Book (the Holy Qur’an) when she separated from her family (adopting seclusion for worship and) moved to the eastern house.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:17: So she adopted veiling from them (the family and the people so that the absolute divine beauty unveils Himself). Then We sent towards her Our Spirit (the angel, Gabriel), who appeared before her in complete form of a human being.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:18: (Maryam [Mary]) said: ‘I seek refuge with the Most Gracious (Lord) from you if you fear (Allah).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:19: (Jibra’il [Gabriel]) said: ‘I am only a messenger from your Lord. (I have come) to bestow upon you a pure son.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:20: (Maryam [Mary]) said: ‘How can there be a son to me, whereas no man has even touched me, nor am I unchaste?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:21: (Jibra’il [Gabriel]) said: ‘(Do not wonder.) It will be the same way. Your Lord says: This (work) is easy for Me, and (the objective is) that We may make him a sign for the people and mercy from Us. And it is a matter (already) decreed.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:22: So Maryam (Mary) conceived him and positioned herself at a remote site, aloof (from the people).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:23: Then the birth pangs drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree. She said (in anxiety): ‘Would that I had died before this and had become totally forgotten!’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:24: Then (Gabriel or ‘Isa [Jesus] himself) called out to her from beneath her: ‘Grieve not. Surely, your Lord has made a water spring flow under you (or has created and laid under you an exalted human being).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:25: And shake the trunk of the date-palm towards you. It will shed fresh ripe dates upon you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:26: So eat and drink and cool (your) eyes (with the sight of your beautiful, lovely baby). Then if you see any man, say (to him by gestures): ‘I have vowed a fast (of silence) to the Most Gracious (Lord), so I shall just not talk to any human being today.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:27: Then, carrying (the baby in her lap), she came to her people. They said: ‘O Maryam (Mary), surely you have brought quite an amazing thing!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:28: O sister of Harun (Aaron)! Neither was your father a bad man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:29: On this Maryam (Mary) pointed to (the baby). They said: ‘How can we talk to him who is (yet) an infant in the cradle?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:30: (The infant himself) spoke out: ‘I am indeed a servant of Allah. He has given me the Book and has raised me as a Prophet.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:31: And wherever I may reside, He has made me an embodiment of blessing. And He has enjoined upon me Prayer and Zakat (the Alms-due) as long as I am alive.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:32: And (He has made me) treat my mother with excellence and has not made me disobedient and ill-fated.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:33: And peace be upon me on the day of my birth, the day of my demise and the day I shall be raised up alive!’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:34: Such is ‘Isa, the son of Maryam (Jesus, the son of Mary. That is) the truth about which these people doubt.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:35: It is not Allah’s Glory that He should take (to Himself anyone as) a son. Holy and Glorified is He (above this)! When He decrees any matter, He only says to it: ‘Be,’ and it becomes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:36: And surely, Allah is my Lord and your Lord (too). So always worship Him alone. This is the straight path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:37: Then their sects began to differ amongst themselves. So the disbelievers are doomed due to the presence on the Mighty Day (of Resurrection).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:38: How (curiously) will they hear (with their ears wide open), and how (bewilderedly) will they see (with their eyes stunned) on the Day when they will appear before Us! But Today the wrongdoers are but (sunk) into manifest error.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:39: And warn them of the Day of Regret (and Shame) when (every) matter shall be decided, but they are rapt in (a state of) negligence and simply do not believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:40: Surely, We alone are the Inheritor of the earth and (also) of those who dwell on it, and (they all) shall be brought back to Us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:41: And recite the account of Ibrahim (Abraham) in the Book (the Holy Qur’an). Surely, he was a Prophet blessed with truthfulness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:42: When he said to his father (i.e., his uncle Azar who brought him up after his father Tarakh died): ‘O my father, why do you worship these (idols) which cannot hear or see, nor can they remove any (troublesome) thing from you?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:43: O father! No doubt there has come to me knowledge (from the divine presence of Allah) which has not come to you. Follow me; I shall show you the straight path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:44: O father! Do not worship Satan. Surely, Satan is a great rebel against the Most Kind (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:45: O father! Indeed, I fear that a torment from the Most Kind (Lord) may seize you and you become a companion of Satan.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:46: (Azar) said: ‘Ibrahim (Abraham), have you turned away from my gods? If you do not practically desist (from this opposition), I shall certainly stone you to death. And keep away from me for a long while.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:47: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘(All right,) peace be on you. I shall beg forgiveness for you from my Lord (even) now. He is indeed very kind to me. (He may bestow guidance upon you.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:48: And I turn away from you (all), and these (idols) which you worship besides Allah. And I worship my Lord (with absolute concentration). I hope that, owing to the worship of my Lord, I shall not be deprived (of His bounty).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:49: So when Ibrahim (Abraham, giving up all social links,) completely separated from the people and those (idols) that they worshipped apart from Allah, We blessed him with Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya‘qub (Jacob, son and grandson,) and We made each of them a Prophet.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:50: And We awarded (all of) them Our (special) mercy, and put their praise and admiration on high rhetoric (amongst the believers of every religion).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:51: And recite the account of Musa (Moses) in (this Holy) Book. Surely, (getting rid of the grip of self,) he had become exalted and was a Messenger and Prophet.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:52: And We called him out from the right of (Mount) Tur, and blessed him with Our (special) nearness for intimate discourse.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:53: And out of Our mercy We granted him his brother Harun (Aaron), making him a Prophet (to assist him in his task).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:54: And recite the account of Isma‘il (Ishmael) in (this) Book. Surely, he was true to (his) promise and was a Messenger (and) a Prophet.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:55: And he used to enjoin on his family Prayer and Zakat (the Alms-due), and (held) the station of mardiyya in the presence of his Lord (i.e., his Lord was well-pleased with him).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:56: And mention in the Book the account of Idris. Verily, he was a Prophet possessing the truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:57: And We raised him to a lofty station.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:58: These are the people on whom Allah bestowed favour from amongst the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those (believers) whom We (saved from Deluge and) carried with Nuh (Noah) in the Ark, and of the posterity of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Isra’il (Israel i.e., Ya‘qub [Jacob]) and of those (chosen ones) whom We guided and exalted. When the Verses of the Most Kind (Lord) are recited to them, they fall down prostrating themselves in (profuse) tears.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:59: Then followed their pathetic successors who gave up Prayers and followed the lusts (of their ill-commanding selves). So they will soon face punishment in the Hereafter (in the Ghayi valley of Hell),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:60: Except the one who repents and believes and persists in righteous works; they will enter Paradise and will not be wronged in the least.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:61: (They will dwell) in such evergreen gardens which the Most Kind (Lord) has promised to His servants in the unseen. Certainly, His promise is about to come true.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:62: They will not hear in it any absurd talk but only greetings of peace (pouring in from every direction). And for them, their sustenance will be (available) in it morning and evening.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:63: This is the Paradise which We shall award as inheritance to those of Our servants who are Godfearing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:64: And, (O Jibra’il [Gabriel], say to My Beloved:) ‘We cannot descend (onto earth) without the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is in between. And your Lord is never forgetful (of you).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:65: (He) is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between the two. So worship Him and remain steadfast in His worship. Do you know who is His namesake?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:66: And man says: ‘Shall I be soon brought forth alive when I die?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:67: Does man not remember that We had created him before this (also) whilst he was just nothing?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:68: So, by your Lord, We will certainly gather them and (all) satans together (on the Day of Judgment). We will then bring them (all) around Hell fallen down in kneeling position.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:69: Then We shall indeed pick out from every group the one who had been most disobedient to, and rebellious against, the Most Kind (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:70: And We know best those who are most deserving of being thrown into Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:71: And there is none of you but will pass over Hell. This (promise,) which will certainly be fulfilled, is absolutely with your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:72: Then We shall deliver the Godfearing, and shall leave the wrongdoers in it (Hell) down on their knees.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:73: And when Our enlightening Verses are recited to them, the disbelievers say to the believers: ‘(See in the selfsame world) which of us two groups has better housing and a more influential social circle.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:74: And how many a people have We destroyed before them who were better off (than these) in worldly assets and pomp and show!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:75: Say: ‘The Most Kind (Lord also) grants respite in age and luxury to the one who is lost in error until, when they see what they have been promised—the torment or the Day of Rising—then they will come to know him who is worse in respect of dwelling and (also) weaker in respect of troops.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:76: Allah adds to the guidance of those who are guided aright. And in the sight of your Lord, the lasting pious deeds are better in respect of reward and (also) more valuable in terms of end result.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:77: Have you seen such a person that rejected Our Signs and said: ‘I shall certainly be given wealth and children (the same way, even on the Day of Resurrection)’?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:78: Is he aware of the unseen, or has he taken any promise from the Most Kind (Lord)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:79: No way! We shall keep writing down what he says, and shall keep increasing for him torment (upon torment).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:80: And (after his death) We shall inherit from him what he proclaims, and he will come to Us all alone (without wealth and children).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:81: And they have taken (many other) gods apart from Allah so that they may be a source of honour for them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:82: By no means! Soon will these (false gods themselves) reject their worship and become their enemies.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:83: Have you not seen that We have sent satans upon the disbelievers? They keep rousing them (against Islam) all the time.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:84: So do not make haste against them (for torment). We Ourselves keep counting the days (for their impending catastrophe).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:85: On the Day, when We shall assemble the Godfearing, and take them (as guests of honour) to the presence of the Most Kind (Lord) on carriages;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:86: And We shall drive the sinners thirsty towards Hell;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:87: (On that Day,) people will not possess the authority to intercede, except those who have taken a promise (of intercession) from the Most Kind (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:88: And (the disbelievers) say: ‘The Most Kind (Lord) has taken (to Himself) a son.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:89: (O disbelievers!) You have indeed brought most horrible and unusual evil (on your tongues).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:90: The heavens may just burst at this (fabricated lie) and the earth split asunder and the mountains fall down to pieces,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:91: That they have attributed a son to the Most Kind (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:92: And it is not befitting the Glory of the Most Kind (Lord) to take (someone as) a son.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:93: Whoever is (dwelling) in the heavens and the earth (whether an angel, a jinn or a human being) will appear just as a servant before the Most Kind (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:94: (Allah) has surely encompassed them with His (knowledge) and has counted them thoroughly (i.e., numbering them one by one).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:95: And each one of them has to appear before His presence alone on the Day of Resurrection.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:96: Surely, those who believed and did pious deeds, the Most Kind (Lord) will create love for them in the hearts (of the people).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:97: So We have indeed made this (Qur’an) easy in your own tongue so that, by means of it, you may communicate good news to the Godfearing and may warn thereby the contentious people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 19:98: And how many a community have We destroyed before them! Do you perceive even a trace or hear even the faintest fizzle of any of them?

null.verse 19:2: Tämä on muistutus Herrasi laupeudesta palvelijaansa Sakariaa kohtaan,
null.verse 19:3: kun hän salassa huokasi Herrallensa.
null.verse 19:4: Hän lausui: »Herrani, totisesti minun ruumiini luut ovat heikentyneet ja ikäni vuoksi minun päässäni välkkyvät harmaat hiukset, mutta milloinkaan ei onni ole minua pettänyt rukoillessani Sinua, oi Herrani.
null.verse 19:5: Minä pelkään sukulaisiani, jotka tulevat perijöikseni; onhan vaimoni hedelmätön; sentähden lćhjoita minulle jälkeläinen,
null.verse 19:6: joka perisi minut ja myöskin Jaakobin lapset, ja oi Herrani, tee hänestä Sinulle mieluisa.»
null.verse 19:7: Oi Sakarias, totisesti, Me ilmoitamme sinulle ilosanoman pojasta, jonka nimi olkoon Johannes. Emme ole vielä luonut ketään sen nimistä.
null.verse 19:8: Hän sanoi: »Herra, kuinka minä voin saada pojan, kun vaimoni on hedelmätön ja itseni on korkea ikä jo heikentänyt?»
null.verse 19:9: Jumala vastasi: »Niin tapahtuu, sanoo Herrasi, se on helppo asia Minulle. Olenhan jo aikaisemmin luonut sinut tyhjästä.»
null.verse 19:10: Hän sanoi: »Herra, anna minulle jokin tunnusmerkki!» Jumala lausui: »Se olkoon sinulle merkiksi, ettet voi kolmeen vuorokauteen puhua ihmisille mitään, vaikka olet aivan terve.»
null.verse 19:11: Senjälkeen hän astui ulos rukouskammiosta kansansa eteen ja puhui kansalleen merkkien avulla: »Julistakaa Hänen kunniaansa aamuin ja illoin.»
null.verse 19:12: Ja hänen pojalleen sanottiin: »Oi Johannes, ota Kirja vastaan halukkaasti!» ja Me annoimme Hänelle viisautta, kun hän oli vielä lapsi.
null.verse 19:13: Annoimme hänelle myös innoitusta ja viattomuutta omastamme, ja hän kunnioitti vanhempiaan
null.verse 19:14: ja oli hyvä heitä kohtaan. Hän ei ollut kapinallinen eikä tottelematon.
null.verse 19:15: Rauha olkoon hänelle sinä päivänä, jolloin hän syntyi, ja sinä päivänä, jolloin hän kuolee, sekä sinä päivänä, jolloin hänet herätetään kuolleista.
null.verse 19:16: Mainitse Kirjassa myös Mariasta: Hän lähti perheensä luota yksinäiseen paikkaan idässä.
null.verse 19:17: Ja hän otti hunnun, joka verhosi hänet heidän katseiltaan. Senjälkeen Me lähetimme henkemme hänen luokseen, ja se ilmestyi hänelle aivan kuin ihmisolento.
null.verse 19:18: Maria lausui: »Totisesti, minä etsin sinua vastaan turvaa laupeimpaan (Jumalaan) luottaen, jos olet hurskas.»
null.verse 19:19: Hän vastasi: »Minä olen vain Herrasi lähettiläs ja tuon sinulle viattoman pojan.»
null.verse 19:20: Maria sanoi: »Kuinka minä voisin saada pojan, kun kukaan ihminen ei ole minuun koskenut enkä ole siveetön?»
null.verse 19:21: Hän vastasi: »Näin sanoo Herrasi: 'Se on helppo asia Minulle, ja se on oleva merkkinä ihmissuvulle ja armonosoituksena Meiltä; onhan asia jo ratkaistu.'»
null.verse 19:22: Silloin Maria vastaanotti hänen lupauksensa ja siirtyi kauas syrjäiseen paikkaan.
null.verse 19:23: Sitten synnytystuskat pakottivat hänet nojautumaan taatelipalmun runkoon. Hän lausui: »Voi, kun olisin kuollut ennen tätä ja minut olisi kokonaan unohdettu.»
null.verse 19:24: Silloin ääni hänen altaan kutsui häntä ja sanoi: »Älä murehdi, totisesti Herrasi on asettanut lähteen jalkojesi juureen.
null.verse 19:25: Ravista palmun runkoa, niin sinulle putoilee kypsiä taateleita.
null.verse 19:26: Sentähden syö ja juo ja kirkastukoon silmäsi. Ja jos näet jonkun ihmisen, niin sano hänelle: »Totisesti, minä olen Laupeimmalle luvannut paastota enkä siis voi puhua tänään kenenkään ihmisolennon kanssa.»
null.verse 19:27: Sitten hän palasi kansansa luokse kantaen lastaan. He huudahtivat: »Oi Maria, totisesti sinä olet tehnyt sangen pahasti.
null.verse 19:28: Oi Aaronin sisar, sinun isäsi ei ollut kelvoton mies eikä äitisi huono nainen.»
null.verse 19:29: Mutta hän vain osoitti lastaan. He sanoivat: »Kuinka voisimme puhua sellaiselle, joka on vielä kehdossa oleva lapsi?»
null.verse 19:30: Poika vastasi: »Totisesti, minä olen Jumalan palvelija. Hän on antanut minulle Kirjan ja Hän on tehnyt minut profeetaksi.
null.verse 19:31: Hän antaa minulle siunauksensa missä tahansa olenkin, ja Hän on määrännyt minun tehtäväkseni rukoilemisen ja almut niin kauan kuin elän.
null.verse 19:32: (Hän on luonut minut) hyväksi äitiäni kohtaan, eikä Hän ole tehnyt minua kapinalliseksi, onnettomaksi.
null.verse 19:33: Rauha ylläni sinä päivänä, jolloin synnyin, sinä päivänä, jolloin kuolen sekä sinä päivänä, jolloin minut herätetään kuolleista.»
null.verse 19:34: Tällainen on Jeesus, Marian poika. Tämä on tosi sanoma, josta he kuitenkin kiistelevät.
null.verse 19:35: Jumalan ei ole soveliasta hankkia itselleen poikaa; kunnia olkoon Hänelle! Kun Hän päättää jonkin asian, Hänen tarvitsee vain sanoa: »Tapahtukoon!» ja se tapahtuu.
null.verse 19:36: Totisesti, Jumala on minun Herrani ja myöskin teidän Herranne; palvelkaa siis Häntä; tämä on oikea tie.»
null.verse 19:37: Mutta lahkolaiset olivat keskenään erimielisiä; voi uskottomia, kun viimeinen päivä heidät kohtaa!
null.verse 19:38: Kuinka hyvin he kuulevatkaan ja näkevät sinä päivänä, jolloin he astuvat eteemme! Mutta tänä päivänä väärämieliset ovat vielä suuren harhan vallassa.
null.verse 19:39: Varoita heitä murheen päivästä, jolloin asia on jo ratkaistu, koska he ovat välinpitämättömiä ja epäuskoisia.
null.verse 19:40: Totisesti, Me perimme maan ja kaikki, jotka siinä ovat. Ja Meidän luoksemme on heidän palattava.
null.verse 19:41: Mainitse Kirjassa myös Aabrahamista. Hän oli vanhurskas mies sekä profeetta.
null.verse 19:42: Hän lausui isälleen: »Oi isäni, miksi palvelet sellaista, joka ei kuule eikä näe eikä kykene vähääkään sinua auttamaan?
null.verse 19:43: Oi isäni, totisesti minulle on suotu tietoa, jota sinä et ole saanut, sentähden seuraa minua, minä olen johdattava sinut oikealle tielle.
null.verse 19:44: Oi isäni, älä palvele saatanaa. Totisesti, saatana on tottelematon Laupeimmalle.
null.verse 19:45: Oi isäni, minä pelkään, että Laupeimman kuritus on sinua kohtaava ja että sinusta tulee saatanan liittolainen.»
null.verse 19:46: Hän vastasi: »Oletko luopunut minun jumalistani, oi Aabraham? Totisesti, ellet muuta mieltäsi, niin minä olen kivittävä sinut kuoliaaksi. Poistu luotani pitkäksi aikaa.»
null.verse 19:47: Aabraham sanoi: »Rauha olkoon sinulle. Olen rukoileva sinulle Herraltani anteeksiantoa. Totisesti, Hän on lempeä minua kohtaan.
null.verse 19:48: Mutta minä luovun sinusta ja siitä, mitä sinä rukoilet Jumalan asemesta. Minä olen rukoileva Herraani ja ehkäpä en ole suotta vetoava Herraan.»
null.verse 19:49: Kun hän oli vaeltanut pois heidän luotaan ja hylännyt sen, mitä he palvelivat, Me annoimme hänelle lisakin ja Jaakobin ja teimme kummastakin profeetan.
null.verse 19:50: Ja Me soimme heille armoamme ja teimme heistä kuuluisia miehiä, totuuden julistajia.
null.verse 19:51: Mainitse Kirjassa myös Mooseksesta. Totisesti, hän kuului valittujen joukkoon ja hän oli myös lähettiläs ja profeetta.
null.verse 19:52: Me kutsuimme hänet vuoren oikealta puolelta ja sallimme hänen läheltä puhutella Itseämme.
null.verse 19:53: Ja armossamme Me teimme hänen veljestään Aaronista profeetan.
null.verse 19:54: Muista Kirjassa myös Ismaelia. Totisesti, hän oli lupaukselle uskollinen, ja hän oli myös lähettiläs ja profeetta.
null.verse 19:55: Hän määräsi perheensä rukoilemaan ja antamaan almuja ja hän oli Herrallensa mieluinen.
null.verse 19:56: Muista Kirjassa myös Idrisiä. Totisesti, hän oli uskollinen ja hänkin oli profeetta.
null.verse 19:57: Ja Me ylensimme hänet korkeaan asemaan.
null.verse 19:58: Nämä kaikki olivat niitä, joille Me annoimme siunauksemme. He olivat profeettoja Aadamin jälkeläisten joukossa ja niiden, jotka pelastimme Nooan mukana. Samoin Aabrahamin ja Ismaelin jälkeläisten joukossa sekä niiden, joille olemme antanut johdatuksen ja jotka olemme valinnut. Kun heille lueteltiin laupeimman Jumalan tunnusmerkkejä, he lankesivat maahan palvoen ja kyyneliä vuodattaen.
null.verse 19:59: Mutta heidän jälkeensä tuli sellaisia, jotka laiminlöivät rukouksensa ja seurasivat himojaan. Siksi he saavatkin palkan luopumuksestaan.
null.verse 19:60: Mutta ne, jotka kääntyvät Jumalan puoleen ja uskovat ja jotka suorittavat hyviä tekoja, saavat astua puutarhaan, eikä heille tehdä pienintäkään vääryyttä:
null.verse 19:61: he astuvat heille näkymättömiin autuaisiin puutarhoihin, jotka Armahtaja on palvelijoillensa luvannut. Totisesti, Hänen lupauksensa on täyttyvä.
null.verse 19:62: He eivät kuule siellä mitään turhaa puhetta, vaan ainoastaan sanan »Rauha!» Ja ravintonsa he saavat sekä aamuin että illoin.
null.verse 19:63: Tällainen on puutarha, jonka Me annamme perinnöksi niille palvelijoillemme, jotka ovat hurskaita.
null.verse 19:64: Ja enkelit sanovat: »Me laskeudumme maan päälle vain Herrasi käskystä. Hänelle kuuluu kaikki, mikä on edessämme ja mikä on takanamme, ja kaikki, mikä on näiden välissä.» Eikä Herrasi ole huonomuistinen.
null.verse 19:65: Hän on taivaitten ja maan ja kaiken niiden välisen Herra. Sentähden palvelkaa Häntä ja pysykää kestävinä palvelemisessanne. Tunnetko ketään, joka olisi Hänen nimensä kaltainen?
null.verse 19:66: Ja kuitenkin ihminen sanoo: »Kuinka, herätetäänkö minut todellakin kuoltuani jälleen eloon?»
null.verse 19:67: Eikö ihminen lainkaan muista, että Me loimme hänet jo kerran ennen aivan tyhjästä?
null.verse 19:68: Herrasi kautta! Me kokoamme varmasti heidät ja saatanat ja saatamme heidät polvistumaan helvetin ympärille.
null.verse 19:69: Senjälkeen Me erotamme jokaisesta lahkosta ne, jotka kiivaimmin uhmailivat Laupeinta vastaan.
null.verse 19:70: Totisesti, Me tunnemme parhaiten ne, jotka suurimmalla syyllä on syöstävä helvettiin.
null.verse 19:71: Teidän joukossanne ei ole ainoatakaan, joka ei sinne joutuisi. Tämä on Herrasi sitova määräys.
null.verse 19:72: Sitten Me pelastamme ne, jotka harjoittavat hartautta, mutta väärintekijät Me hylkäämme sinne polvillensa.
null.verse 19:73: Ja kun selvät merkkimme on heille ilmoitettu, sanovat epäuskon valtaamat niille, jotka uskovat: »Kumpi puoli on edullisemmassa asemassa ja näyttää lukuisemmalta?»
null.verse 19:74: Kuinka monta ennen heitä elänyttä sukupolvea olemmekaan hävittänyt, vaikka ne olivat heitä rikkaampia ja uhkeampia!
null.verse 19:75: Sano: »Jotka kulkevat harhaannuksissa, niiden päiviä Laupein pidentää, kunnes he näkevät, mitä heille on luvattu, rangaistus taikka tuomion hetki, ja tulevat tietämään, kenen asema on huonoin ja kenen voimat heikoimmat.»
null.verse 19:76: Mutta niille, jotka vaeltavat oikeata tietä, Jumala enentää johdatustansa. Ja pysyväiset hyvät työt saavat Jumalan luona paremman palkan ja paremman turvapaikan.
null.verse 19:77: Oletko nähnyt sellaisen, joka ei usko merkkeihimme ja sanoo: »Totisesti, minulle annetaan rikkautta ja lapsia.»
null.verse 19:78: Onko hän siis saanut tietoa näkymättömistä asioista, tai onko hän hankkinut sitoumuksen kaikkein Laupeimmalta?
null.verse 19:79: Totisesti ei. Me kirjoitamme muistiin hänen sanansa ja pidennämme hänen tuskansa aikaa.
null.verse 19:80: Me perimme häneltä pois sen, mistä hän on kerskaillut, ja yksin hän on astuva eteemme.
null.verse 19:81: He ottavat myös Jumalan rinnalle muita jumalia, jotka muka heitä auttavat.
null.verse 19:82: Mutta nämä kieltävät heille osoitetun jumaloimisen ja kääntyvät heidän vastustajikseen.
null.verse 19:83: Etkö ole huomannut, että Me lähetämme pahat henget uskottomien luokse viettelemään näitä kiusaukseen.
null.verse 19:84: Mutta älä hätäile heidän tähtensä. Me määräämme heille luetut päivänsä.
null.verse 19:85: Tulee päivä, jolloin Me kokoamme hurskaat Laupeimman luokse hänen vieraakseen.
null.verse 19:86: Mutta syntiset me ajamme helvettiin janoisena laumana.
null.verse 19:87: Heillä ei ole ketään puoltajaa, paitsi niillä, jotka ovat sopineet Laupeimman kanssa.
null.verse 19:88: He väittävät, että Armahtaja on hankkinut itselleen lapsen.
null.verse 19:89: Totisesti, te olette puhuneet sangen pahasti.
null.verse 19:90: Taivaat saattavat puhjeta ja maa voi repeytyä kappaleiksi ja vuoret luhistua tomuksi,
null.verse 19:91: koska he väittävät Laupeimman hankkineen lapsen.
null.verse 19:92: Onhan sopimatonta, että Laupeimmalla olisi lapsi.
null.verse 19:93: Taivaissa ja maan päällä ei ole ainoatakaan, joka tulisi Laupeimman luo muuten kuin palvelijana.
null.verse 19:94: Totisesti, Hän tietää heidän lukunsa ja Hän on sen tarkoin laskenut.
null.verse 19:95: Ja ylösnousemuksen päivänä jokainen heistä astuu Hänen eteensä omakohtaisesti.
null.verse 19:96: Totisesti, ne, jotka uskovat ja tekevät hyviä töitä, Jumala on palkitseva rakkaudella.
null.verse 19:97: Senvuoksi Me olemme tehnyt Koraanin helposti ymmärrettäväksi sinun kielelläsi, jotta voisit julistaa ilosanomaa hurskaille ja varoittaa riitaisia.
null.verse 19:98: Kuinka monia ennen heitä eläneitä sukupolvia olemmekaan hävittänyt! Saatatko löytää enää ainoatakaan heidän joukostaan tahi kuulla heistä pienintäkään äännähdystä?

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:2: Rappel de la miséricorde de ton Seigneur envers Son serviteur Zacharie,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:3: lorsqu'il adressa à son Seigneur une imploration secrète,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:4: disant : " Mon Seigneur, mes os me supportent avec peine et ma tête a blanchi ! Jamais, mon Seigneur, je n'ai connu la déception en Te priant !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:5: Voici pourtant que je redoute [ce que feront] mes proches après ma mort, car ma femme est stérile. Accorde-moi donc un descendant venu de Toi.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:6: Il héritera de moi ; il héritera de la famille de Jacob. Mon Seigneur, fais qu'il te soit agréable ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:7: " O Zacharie ! Nous t'annonçons la bonne nouvelle d'un garçon ; son nom sera Jean (Yahya), nom que Nous n'avons attribué à personne avant lui ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:8: Zacharie dit : " Mon Seigneur ! Comment pourrais-je avoir un garçon alors que ma femme est stérile et que j'ai atteint l'âge de la décrépitude ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:9: Dieu dit : " Il en sera ainsi ! Comme l'a proclamé ton Seigneur : "Cela m'est facile. Je t'ai déjà créé auparavant, alors que tu n'étais rien""
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:10: Zacharie dit : " Mon Seigneur, donne-moi un signe ! " Dieu dit : " Ton signe, c'est que durant trois jours entiers tu ne parles pas aux hommes ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:11: Zacharie sortit alors du sanctuaire et rejoignit les siens, à qui il fit savoir qu'ils devaient glorifier le Seigneur matin et soir.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:12: " O Yahya, tiens-toi fermement à l'Ecriture ! " Et Nous lui donnâmes la sagesse dès sa petite enfance,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:13: ainsi que, venant de Nous, la tendresse et la pureté. Il craignait Dieu,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:14: il était bon envers ses père et mère ; il n'était ni arrogant, ni rebelle.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:15: Que la Paix soit sur lui le jour où il naquit, le jour où il mourra et le jour où il sera ressuscité !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:16: Et mentionne dans le Livre Marie, comment elle quitta sa famille et se retira en un lieu situé vers l'Orient.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:17: Elle plaça un voile entre elle et les siens. Nous lui envoyâmes alors Notre Esprit, qui lui apparut sous la forme d'un homme de belle prestance.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:18: Elle dit : " Je prends refuge auprès du Miséricordieux contre toi, si tu crains Dieu ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:19: Il dit : " Je ne suis que l'envoyé de ton Seigneur, venu pour te donner un garçon pur ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:20: Elle dit : " Comment aurais-je un garçon ? Aucun mortel ne m'a jamais touchée et je ne suis pas une dissolue ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:21: Il dit : " Il en est ainsi ; ton Seigneur a dit : "Cela m'est facile. Et afin que Nous fassions de lui un signe pour les hommes et une miséricorde venue de Nous. C'est là un décret irrévocable" ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:22: Elle devint grosse de l'enfant et se retira avec lui dans un lieu écarté.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:23: Les douleurs de l'enfantement la surprirent auprès d'un tronc de palmier. " Malheur à moi, s'écria-t-elle, que ne suis-je déjà morte, totalement oubliée ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:24: Une voix venue d'en-dessous d'elle l'appela : " Ne t'afflige pas ! Ton Seigneur a fait jaillir à tes pieds un ruisseau.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:25: Secoue vers toi le tronc du palmier ; il fera tomber sur toi des dattes fraîches et mûres.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:26: Mange, bois et rafraîchis tes yeux. Et si tu vois quelque mortel, dis : " J'ai voué un jeûne au Miséricordieux ; aujourd'hui je ne parlerai à personne !" ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:27: Elle se rendit ensuite auprès des siens, portant l'enfant. Ils dirent : " O Marie ! Tu as fait quelque chose de bien étrange !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:28: O sœur d'Aaron ! Ton père n'était pas un homme mauvais et ta mère n'était pas une dissolue ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:29: Elle leur fit alors un signe en direction du nouveau-né. Ils s'exclamèrent : " Comment parlerions-nous à un petit enfant au berceau ? ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:30: Celui-ci dit : " Je suis, en vérité, le serviteur de Dieu. Il m'a donné le Livre et Il a fait de moi un prophète ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:31: Il m'a béni, en quelque lieu où je me trouve ; Il m'a recommandé la prière et l'aumône, tant que je vivrai,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:32: et la bonté envers ma mère. Il ne m'a fait ni arrogant, ni rebelle.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:33: Que la Paix soit sur moi le jour où je naquis, le jour où je mourrai, et le jour où je serai ressuscité ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:34: Tel est Jésus, fils de Marie, Parole de Vérité, sur qui ils jettent le doute.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:35: Il n'appartient pas à Dieu de se prendre un enfant. Qu'Il soit glorifié! Lorsqu'Il a décrété une chose, Il n'a qu'à lui dire : " Sois ! ", et elle est.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:36: [Jésus dit :]" Dieu est, en vérité, mon Seigneur et votre Seigneur. Adorez-le ! Voilà la voie droite ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:37: Les factions ont eu entre elles des divergences. Malheur à ceux qui n'ont pas cru à la comparution d'un Jour solennel !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:38: Ecoute-les, et observe-les le Jour où ils viendront à Nous. Mais les iniques se trouvent aujourd'hui dans un égarement évident.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:39: Avertis-les du Jour de la lamentation, lorsque s'accomplira le décret et que, plongés dans l'insouciance, ils ne croiront pas.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:40: C'est Nous, en vérité, qui hériterons de la terre et de ceux qui s'y trouvent, lesquels seront ramenés à Nous.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:41: Mentionne Abraham dans le Livre. Ce fut un juste et un prophète.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:42: Il dit à son père : " O mon père ! Pourquoi adores-tu ce qui n'entend pas, ne voit pas, et ne t'est d'aucun profit ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:43: O mon père ! Il m'est échu une portion de la science qui ne t'est pas parvenue. Suis-moi : je te guiderai sur une voie droite.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:44: O mon père, n'adore pas Satan ! Certes, Satan le Démon est révolté contre le Miséricordieux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:45: O mon père ! Je crains qu'un châtiment du Miséricordieux ne t'afflige et que tu ne deviennes un suppôt de Satan ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:46: Il dit : " O Abraham, éprouverais-tu de l'aversion pour mes divinités ? Si tu ne cesses pas, je te lapiderai. Eloigne-toi de moi pour un temps ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:47: Abraham dit : " Paix sur toi ! Je demanderai pardon pour toi à mon Seigneur. Il est bienveillant envers moi.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:48: Je m'éloigne de vous et de ce que vous implorez en dehors de Dieu. Moi, j'implore mon Seigneur ; peut-être ne serai-je pas déçu dans la supplique que j'adresse à mon Seigneur ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:49: Quand Abraham se fut éloigné de ces gens et de ce qu'ils adoraient en dehors de Dieu, Nous lui avons donné Isaac et Jacob, et de chacun d'eux Nous avons fait un prophète.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:50: Nous les avons comblés de Notre miséricorde et Nous les avons dotés d'une langue sublime exprimant la vérité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:51: Mentionne Moïse dans le Livre ; c'était un croyant sincère et il fut un envoyé et prophète.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:52: Nous l'appelâmes depuis le versant droit du Mont [Sinaï], et Nous l'approchâmes de Nous en toute intimité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:53: Et, par un effet de Notre miséricorde, Nous lui donnâmes son frère Aaron comme prophète.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:54: Mentionne aussi Ismaël dans le Livre ; il était fidèle dans sa promesse et c'était un envoyé, un prophète.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:55: Il ordonnait à sa famille la prière et l'aumône, et il était agréable à son Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:56: Mentionne aussi Enoch (Idris) dans le Livre ; c'était un juste, un prophète
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:57: et Nous l'élevâmes à une station sublime.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:58: Ceux-là sont ceux que Dieu a comblés de Ses grâces parmi les prophètes de la descendance d'Adam, parmi ceux que Nous avons portés [dans l'Arche]avec Noé, parmi la descendance d'Abraham et d'Israël, et parmi ceux que Nous avons dirigés et que Nous avons élus. Lorsque les versets du Miséricordieux leur étaient récités, ils tombaient prosternés en pleurant.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:59: Mais après eux vinrent des successeurs qui délaissèrent la prière et suivirent leurs passions, ne rencontrant en fin de compte que l'égarement,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:60: à l'exception de ceux qui se sont repentis, ont cru et ont agi avec piété : ceux-là sont entrés dans le Jardin et n'ont été lésés en rien.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:61: Les Jardins d'Eden, le Miséricordieux les a promis à Ses serviteurs dans le Mystère, et Sa promesse ne manque pas de s'accomplir.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:62: Ils n'y entendent aucune parole futile, mais seulement [le mot] : " Paix ! ", et ils y reçoivent leur nourriture le matin et le soir.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:63: Tel est le Jardin dont Nous faisons hériter ceux de Nos serviteurs qui Nous ont craint.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:64: [Les anges disent, s'adressant à Muhammad :]" Nous ne descendons que sur l'ordre de ton Seigneur. A Lui appartient ce qui est devant nous, ce qui est derrière nous et ce qui se trouve entre deux. Ton Seigneur n'est oublieux de rien !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:65: Il est le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui existe entre les deux : adore-Le donc et persévère dans Son adoration. Connais-tu quelqu'un digne de porter Son Nom ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:66: L'homme dit : " Lorsque je serai mort, me fera-t-on resurgir vivant ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:67: L'homme ne se souvient-il pas que Nous l'avons créé auparavant, alors qu'il n'était rien ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:68: Par ton Seigneur ! Nous les rassemblerons tous, eux et les démons, puis Nous les présenterons agenouillés autour de la Géhenne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:69: Ensuite, Nous détacherons de chaque groupe ceux qui étaient les plus rebelles envers le Miséricordieux,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:70: car Nous connaissons parfaitement ceux qui méritent le plus d'y brûler.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:71: Il n'est aucun d'entre vous qui ne devra s'en approcher : c'est là un arrêt fixé par ton Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:72: Nous sauverons ensuite ceux qui craignent Dieu et Nous y laisserons les iniques agenouillés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:73: Lorsque Nos versets leur sont lus, portant l'évidence, ceux qui mécroient disent à ceux qui croient : " Lequel de nos deux groupes occupe-t-il la meilleure station et jouit-il de la meilleure compagnie ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:74: Combien n'avons-Nous pas anéantis avant eux de générations qui les surpassaient en richesses et en splendeur !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:75: Dis : " Que le Miséricordieux veuille prolonger d'un temps la vie de ceux qui sont égarés, jusqu'à ce qu'ils voient ce qui leur était annoncé, que ce soit le châtiment ou que ce soit l'Heure ! ". Ils sauront alors qui est dans la plus mauvaise posture et possède l'armée la plus faible.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:76: Dieu affermira les pas de ceux qui suivent la bonne direction. Les œuvres durables, pieuses, obtiendront auprès de ton Seigneur une meilleure récompense et une meilleure rétribution.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:77: As-tu vu celui qui a refusé de croire à Nos signes, disant : " On me donnera certainement des richesses et des enfants "?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:78: Aurait-il percé le Mystère, ou aurait-il passé un pacte avec le Miséricordieux ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:79: Rien de cela ! Nous consignerons ce qu'il dit et Nous prolongerons longuement son châtiment.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:80: C'est Nous qui hériterons de ce qu'il annonce, et il viendra à Nous esseulé.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:81: Ils ont pris des divinités en dehors de Dieu pour en tirer puissance.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:82: Rien de cela ! Ces divinités renieront leur adoration et elles deviendront leurs adversaires.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:83: Ne vois-tu pas que Nous envoyons contre les mécréants des démons qui les incitent sans cesse au mal ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:84: Ne te hâte pas de les combattre, car c'est Nous qui comptons leurs jours.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:85: Le Jour où Nous rassemblerons auprès du Miséricordieux ceux qui Le craignent en toute dignité,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:86: et où Nous conduirons les coupables vers la Géhenne comme un troupeau à l'abreuvoir,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:87: seuls bénéficieront d'une intercession ceux qui auront pris un engagement auprès du Miséricordieux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:88: Certains ont dit : " Le Miséricordieux s'est donné un fils ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:89: Vous avancez là une chose abominable,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:90: pour laquelle peu s'en faut que les cieux ne se fendent, que la terre ne s'entrouvre et que les montagnes ne s'écroulent !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:91: Ils ont attribué un fils au Miséricordieux,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:92: alors que le Miséricordieux ne saurait aucunement se donner un fils !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:93: Il n'existe aucun être, ni dans les cieux ni sur la terre, qui puisse se présenter devant le Miséricordieux autrement que comme un serviteur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:94: Il les a tous recensés et bien comptés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:95: Chacun viendra à Lui, esseulé, au Jour de la Résurrection.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:96: Certes, ceux qui croient et pratiquent les œuvres pies, le Miséricordieux les traitera avec une pleine sollicitude.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:97: Nous avons facilité la récitation du Coran dans ta langue, afin que, par lui, tu annonces la bonne nouvelle à ceux qui craignent Dieu et que tu avertisses les entêtés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 19:98: Combien de générations n'avons-Nous pas anéanties avant eux ! En perçois-tu quelque reste de vie ou en entends-tu quelque murmure ?

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:2: C’est un récit de la miséricorde de ton Seigneur envers Son serviteur Zacharie.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:3: Lorsqu’il invoqua son Seigneur d’une invocation secrète,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:4: et dit : «ô mon Seigneur , mes os sont affaiblis et ma tête s’est enflammée de cheveux blancs. [Cependant], je n’ai jamais été malheureux [déçu] en te priant, ô mon Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:5: Je crains [le comportement] de mes héritiers, après mois. Et ma propre femme est stérile. Accorde-moi, de Ta part, un descendant
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:6: qui hérite de moi et hérite de la famille de Jacob. Et fais qu’il te soit agréable, ô mon Seigneur».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:7: «ô Zacharie, Nous t’annonçons la bonne nouvelle d’un fils. Son nom sera Yahya [Jean]. Nous ne lui avons pas donné auparavant d’homonyme».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:8: Et [Zacharie dit]: «ô mon Seigneur, comment aurai-je un fils, quand ma femme est stérile et que je suis très avancé en vieillesse ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:9: [Dieu] lui dit : «Ainsi sera-t-il ! Ton Seigneur a dit : «Ceci m’est facile. Et avant cela, Je t’ai créé alors que tu n’étais rien».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:10: «ô mon Seigneur, dit [Zacharie], accorde-moi un signe». «Ton signe, dit [Dieu,] sera que tu ne pourras pas parler aux gens pendant trois nuits tout en étant bien portant.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:11: Il sortit donc du sanctuaire vers son peuple; puis il leur fit signe de prier matin et soir.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:12: ...«ô Yahya, tiens fermement au Livre (la Thora) ! » Nous lui donnâmes la sagesse alors qu’il était enfant,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:13: ainsi que la tendresse de Notre part et la pureté. Il était pieux,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:14: et dévoué envers ses père et mère; et ne fut ni violent ni désobéissant.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:15: Que la paix soit sur lui le jour où il naquit, le jour où il mourra, et le jour où il sera ressuscité vivant !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:16: Mentionne, dans le Livre (le Coran), Marie, quand elle se retira de sa famille en un lieu vers l’Orient.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:17: Elle mit entre elle et eux un voile. Nous lui envoyâmes Notre Esprit (Gabriel), qui se présenta à elle sous la forme d’un homme parfait.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:18: Elle dit : «Je me réfugie contre toi auprès du Tout Miséricordieux. Si tu es pieux, [ne m’approche point].
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:19: Il dit : «Je suis en fait un Messager de ton Seigneur pour te faire don d’un fils pur».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:20: Elle dit : «Comment aurais-je un fils, quand aucun homme ne m’a touchée, et je ne suis pas prostituée ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:21: Il dit : «Ainsi sera-t-il ! Cela M’est facile, a dit ton Seigneur ! Et Nous ferons de lui un signe pour les gens, et une miséricorde de Notre part. C’est une affaire déjà décidée».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:22: Elle devient donc enceinte [de l’enfant], et elle se retira avec lui en un lieu éloigné.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:23: Puis les douleurs de l’enfantement l’amenèrent au tronc du palmier, et elle dit : «Malheur à moi ! Que je fusse morte avant cet instant ! Et que je fusse totalement oubliée ! »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:24: Alors, il l’appela d’au-dessous d’elle , [lui disant : ] «Ne t’afflige pas. Ton Seigneur a placé à tes pieds une source.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:25: Secoue vers toi le tronc du palmier : il fera tomber sur toi des dattes fraîches et mûres.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:26: Mange donc et bois et que ton oeil se réjouisse ! Si tu vois quelqu’un d’entre les humains, dis [lui : ] «Assurément, j’ai voué un jeûne au Tout Miséricordieux : je ne parlerai donc aujourd’hui à aucun être humain».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:27: Puis elle vint auprès des siens en le portant [le bébé]. Ils dirent : «ô Marie, tu as fait une chose monstrueuse !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:28: Soeur de Haroun , ton père n’était pas un homme de mal et ta mère n’était pas une prostituée».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:29: Elle fit alors un signe vers lui [le bébé]. Ils dirent : «Comment parlerions-nous à un bébé au berceau ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:30: Mais [le bébé] dit : «Je suis vraiment le serviteur de Dieu. Il m’a donné le Livre et m’a désigné Prophète.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:31: Où que je sois, Il m’a rendu béni; et Il m’a recommandé, tant que je vivrai, la prière et la Zakat ;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:32: et la bonté envers ma mère. Il ne m’a fait ni violent ni malheureux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:33: Et que la paix soit sur moi le jour où je naquis, le jour où je mourrai, et le jour où je serai ressuscité vivant».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:34: Tel est Issa (Jésus), fils de Marie : parole de vérité, dont ils doutent.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:35: Il ne convient pas à Dieu de S’attribuer un fils. Gloire et Pureté à Lui ! Quand Il décide d’une chose, Il dit seulement : «Sois ! » et elle est.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:36: «Certes, Dieu est mon Seigneur tout comme votre Seigneur. Adorez-le donc. Voilà un droit chemin».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:37: [Par la suite,] les sectes divergèrent entre elles. Alors, malheur aux mécréants lors de la vue d’un jour terrible !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:38: Comme ils entendront et verront bien le jour où ils viendront à Nous ! Mais aujourd’hui, les injustes sont dans un égarement évident.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:39: Et avertis-les du jour du Regret , quand tout sera réglé; alors qu’ils sont [dans ce monde] inattentifs et qu’ils ne croient pas.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:40: C’est Nous, en vérité, qui hériterons la terre et tout ce qui s’y trouve, et c’est à Nous qu’ils seront ramenés.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:41: Et mentionne dans le Livre, Abraham C’était un très véridique et un Prophète.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:42: Lorsqu’il dit à son père : «ô mon père, pourquoi adores-tu ce qui n’entend ni ne voit, et ne te profite en rien ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:43: ô mon père, il m’est venu de la science ce que tu n’as pas reçu; suis-moi, donc, je te guiderai sur une voie droite.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:44: ô mon père, n’adore pas le Diable, car le Diable désobéit au Tout Miséricordieux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:45: ô mon père, je crains qu’un châtiment venant du Tout Miséricordieux ne te touche et que tu ne deviennes un allié du Diable».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:46: Il dit : «ô Abraham, aurais-tu du dédain pour mes divinités ? Si tu ne cesses pas, certes je te lapiderai, éloigne-toi de moi pour bien longtemps».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:47: «Paix sur toi», dit Abraham. «J’implorerai mon Seigneur de te pardonner car Il a m’a toujours comblé de Ses bienfaits.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:48: Je me sépare de vous, ainsi que de ce que vous invoquez, en dehors de Dieu, et j’invoquerai mon Seigneur. J’espère ne pas être malheureux dans mon appel à mon Seigneur».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:49: Puis, lorsqu’il se fut séparé d’eux et de ce qu’ils adoraient en dehors de Dieu, Nous lui fîmes don d’Isaac et de Jacob; et de chacun Nous fîmes un prophète.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:50: Et Nous leur donnâmes de par Notre miséricorde, et Nous leur accordâmes un langage sublime de vérité.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:51: Et mentionne dans le Livre Moïse. C’était vraiment un élu, et c’était un Messager et un prophète.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:52: Du côté droit du Mont (Sinaï) Nous l’appelâmes et Nous le fîmes approcher tel un confident.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:53: Et par Notre miséricorde, Nous lui donnâmes Aaron son frère comme prophète.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:54: Et mentionne Ismaël, dans le Livre. Il était fidèle à ses promesses; et c’était un Messager et un prophète.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 19:55: Et il commandait à sa famille la prière et la Zakat; et il était agréé auprès de son Seigneur.
